Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus we begin with the remedies of Albucazim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, sons, since you have completed this book, which is the last part of the science of medicine, for the completion of its consequences in it, and for its explanations, and for its declarations, it seems to me that you have fulfilled what I wanted from you in this treatise, which is a part of my operation on hand, so it is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the operation on hand is spread throughout our region and in our entire private time, until they have very little perception of its science, and its investigation has been stopped; and I do not remain silent about it except for some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which muddy the waters and lead to those errors and hesitations until the intentions of it are closed and its strength is elongated.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that you have vivified this hand in the ordering of this treatise according to the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that they come into the forms of the ferraments of cauteries and other instruments of the work as if by addition of the declaration, and for preparation of it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why there is no expert artist in this our time, is because the art of medicine is long and it covers the whole actor who needs to be exercised in the science of anatomy which Galen described until he knew the juices of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and had knowledge of the bones, nerves and ligaments, and their number, and their precision; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and of the places of their establishment.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this Hippocrates said that a name is not enough, but rather in the small work, and mainly in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already said this about him in the introduction of this book; because who does not know what we have said about anatomy, is not exempt from falling into error, by which many men have died, thus you have seen many of them, because they were formed in this science and got away from that science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	Because you have seen a foolish doctor who has incompetently induced an scrophilous abscess on the neck of a woman, and damaged some arteries of the neck so that great blood flowed until the woman nearly died among his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who promised that he would remove a stone from a man's bladder which had progressed to his state, and the stone was large, and he came to him and extracted that stone in a piece of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already called him to remove that, and I saw that due to the size of the stone and due to the disposition of the patient's body, he was going to die under his hands.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who received a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and he made a bad incision on the thigh of a man who had a fracture in his leg; and due to the doctor's ignorance, he removed the fracture, above the wound, with pumice stones and asters in strong structure, and did not leave the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he dislocated the joint according to his foolish desires, and then he relaxed, and then he left it for several days and commanded that we should not disturb the limb; and it was thus until the thigh and foot became putrid with apostemes, and he came to perdition.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you have already called him to it, and he has prepared himself to dislocate the limb, and thus he achieved tranquility and also alleviated his own pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But the corruption had already spread to the member, so that it could not be restrained, and did not cease to walk with the corruption in the member until the patient suffered.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who perforated a cancerous abscess, and he ulcerated it for several days, until the evil of it was magnified in his lord's sense.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason is that the cancerous tumor was pure melancholic humor, then it did not cover that it would come to him at all, but rather that it was in a member which suffered from everything, and had been held back from everything.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation on hand be divided into two devotions: one is an operation where health is associated, and another work where danger is in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already existed in every place of this book where I have found operation in which there is error and fear; because it is necessary for you to guard against that and leave it, so that the foolish ones do not take the way to speak and deceive you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And then take your arms in solicitude and protection of God, and your evils are abolished and strengthened.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And you have used the best way for the grace of God to obtain health and laudable success, and you have left the terrible evils of difficult healing, and you have stopped your arms from that which makes you afraid, so that you may stay in your faith and in your name you will not be evasive: because it remains in your glory, and afterwards in the world and finally among your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Although there are some difficulties in this patient's joints:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"There is no medical treatment for a bad case of gout, because bad doctors do not know its name."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	"And I have divided this book into three chapters."
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	"Here begins the division of the book, and first of the first part."
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	"The first chapter deals with the head entering into the feet, in the forms of instruments and in the ferrumens of cauteries, and what is necessary for the operation."
La divisio de la segonda partida.	"The division of the second part."
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The second chapter, on suction and perforation, and of cupping glasses, and of poultices, and of extraction of arrows and of similarities to those, all capitulated and ordered according to the forms of instruments."
Divisio de la tersa partida.	"The division of the third part."
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and of curvature correction and of similarities to those; a chapter ordered from head to feet, and according to the forms of instruments."
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	"On cautery I make a focus and medicine acute and reminiscence of the operation."
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	"I begin the treatise on the entire book."
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	"So that I indicate the quality of the juvenations of that cautery and of its instruments, and in what complexity it is prohibited to use cautery."
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	"Therefore I say that the sermon on the quality of the juvenation of cautery and of its instrument is long and prolix, and subtle for science, and secretly hidden; and already many wise men have spoken about it, and they disagree with each other, and I need a little bit of their sermons, fearing prolongation."
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	"Therefore I say that cautery corresponds to the entire universal complexity, which is either matter or multiple matters, except for two complexities, which are warm complexities of matter."
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	"In the warm and dry complexity matter disagrees; because some said that cautery is juvenated to that, and others said the opposite of that, that cautery is not convenient in bad gout which is by quality and by dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that bad gout warm and dry matter is healed by cautery and dryness."
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	"And they say that those who say the opposite of that, that by cautery it is made juvenation in all bad warm and dry gout that occurs in men's bodies, because when you compare men's bodies with the humidity of them to the complexity of fire, you find that men's bodies are cold."
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	"And I say by the sermon of that, that experience has already taught me some things to discover."
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	"Moreover, I do not know what comes over that which has already been experimented and exercised in the chapter of cautery for the last exercise, and to know the diversity of the complexity of men's bodies and the disposition of their gouts in their meteyssas, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the space of time of those."
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	"Moreover, in the other complexities, it is not about your fear, and especially in the cold and humid gouts, because all doctors have agreed on those, and they do not disagree about the juvenation with cautery in those."
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	"And you know, sons, that the secret of cure by cautery is fire and its goodness, so on cautery I make comburent medicine, because the fire is simple, the action of which does not penetrate except to the member which is cauterized and does not touch another member unless it is a small nuisance."
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	"Moreover, the action of comburent medicine penetrates to that in the members which are affected by it, and strongly makes them come into the difficult-to-heal gouty member and strongly assists."
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	"Moreover, fire, by its sublime nobility and goodness of substance, does not do anything but overflow; and it is already known to us through experience and long service of studying the art about the truth of causes; and for that I have excused the length of the sermon; and if it were not that I did not read my own book in this pause to you, secretly hidden fire, and the quality of its operation in bodies and of the expulsion by which it expels gouts, a philosophical sermon demonstrated, which would be acute in your own footsteps."
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	"And you know, sons, that they disagree about the time when it is convenient to use cautery and pause at the best time of spring."
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	"And I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the nuisance from the accidental time is submerged in the juvenation of that which I have with cautery, and especially if cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and fast, which do not suffer delay so that it is feared by those who bring malice, which is greater than small nuisance entering at the wrong time."
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	"And you do not see in your footsteps, or, sons, that which is not esteemed except by the common people and foolish doctors, so it is that at that gout which is healed by cautery, it does not return at all times, and they pause at that consequence."
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not so because the doctors do not understand that cautery is only in place of medicine, which alters the complexion and dries out the humors that are the cause of the pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Perhaps emperor, I will place cauteries superficially on medicine to show the value and truth of its operation and greatness of your wise lordship.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the disease returns at some point in time, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of the disease, and its truth, and what has been prepared in their body through the addition of superfluous humors, and what has happened to them in acquiring habits and semblances of those causes; unless the disease in which cautery is administered is a subtle disease with few superfluous humors and moisture, thus as cautery for toothache and similar to that, it is possible that in them no pain returns, but rather it is made small.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is a common saying that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and it is a desperate remedy, not because they understand it, for they believe that there is no cure that can be achieved through medicine or any other cause that would make them resort to cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the intention that cautery is the last resort of medicine is only when they administer the methods of cure in certain diseases, and those medicines do not concur, and thus at the end of the cause they administer cautery, and it is made suitable for that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here onwards it is clear that cautery is not the last resort of medicine, but rather according to the intention which understands the simple and foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that the ancients believed that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the limitation of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not make a scar, as if it is not absolutely true, because you have already probed and experienced that it does not do so except in certain bodies like the others, and cautery with gold is good and better than with iron, thus as they said; but emperor, when you perform cautery with golden focus, it is not for you to declare, because it depends on the quantity that you want for the rigor of the gold, and prepare to receive heat; and if you adjust over the ignited focus, the gold melts per the focus, and sometimes in the focus some layers are made so that the artisan can occupy themselves with that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And therefore it is done with iron cautery, we do not push lightly and do not propose immediately the rectitude of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head within the feet, so that I can clarify what is demanded from them.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cautery for headache caused by coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers on the humidity and coldness above the servile accident of which there are two causes, thus it is the cause of swelling and multitude of flux rheumatic, called corrissa, from the head to the divisions of the veins and of the fluent auricles, and multitude of drowsiness, and of toothache and of gout, and universally of all diseases that come from coldness, thus as paralytically, swelling and apoplexy, and similarly in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is this, that primarily it commands the patient to evacuate the medicine in a laxative manner from the mundane head, for three or four nights, according to the truth of the patient and their age and custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then it commands him to shave his head with a razor, and then makes him sit between his thighs on a warmed-up bench and places his hands over his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then places the razor of his palm on the sole of the foot between the veins of his nose.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	Perhaps emperor, as the doctor said in my place, it has happened, thus that place is tender, and then ignite the olive oil cautery, of which this is the form.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then places that on the sensitive spot that is tender, in a manner that descends, in which the doctor's hand is constricted little by little, and you turn it around.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lifts his hand lightly and regards the spot, and if you see already from the bone being uncovered some quantity of hair, thus as the quantity of grain of errors, then lifts his hand, and if it does not turn to his hand in that iron, or another of that, if it is frozen, until it is seen from the bone what I have said to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then takes a little salt and dissolves it over the spot and leaves it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then places it on the bent edge of the box and leaves it on top until the crust of the focus is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then cures the spot with four-part angelic water until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when the Roman plague breaks out, so much better gets the scar, because it is better and more jovial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They should remove some of those that are to be cauterized from the code inward into the bone, and hold the cautery inward so that it is burned in some part of the bone's thickness.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then return to what has been adjusted on the bone, and then take care.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They should also push the cautery through to the back, until it penetrates into the bone strongly, so that the bone breaks, and this is the way to release small fractures:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They estimate at that place where the vapors of the head expire.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And hold the open wound for a long time, and then take care until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two special kinds of cauteries in everything, except in some homes according to the way of fear; and therefore, you must, my better health is there, when it is; because the head is developed by solution of continuity of the same as we have testified in other members, and mainly when the head of the patient is of frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the kind of cautery first mentioned is more salvaged and better for me; and from that house and in that work I am healthy.
Capitol segon.	Following chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	About the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When the entire head aches with chronic and long pain and it is in prolonged illness, and uses remedies of poultices and of bandages and of cupping glasses and of plasters and of ointments and of catheters and of similar things, and mainly if it has been cauterized by a cautery which recounts and does not alleviate any of those causes, then consider that the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and it is not frail and troublesome with great cold, then that cautery is another cautery besides the one mentioned.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauteries that one on the horn of the dry head with a cautery inward so that the code is parted.

Cut the code and discover the quantity of bone which we have recounted and cautery that one with a cautery in the back part of the head at the place which is called "vas" — and it is that place where the windy pause is made.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And lift your hand in that way, and do not discover the bone, because the patient suffers so much great diverse pain from the pain of all the other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you will direct this cautery to its place, because it is necessary that the cautery which is being cauterized on the horns of the head and the occiput is more subtly cauterized than that which is cauterized in the middle of the head; and this is the way of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cautery of non-ancient migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr. Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	One cautery with acute burning medicine is that you take a handful of salt, and scrape it off and bind the extremities of the hand with both hands on the heads.

And then strengthen over it with a stopped constriction, and leave that for three hours' space; and then remove the dressing and treat the wound, and leave the wound open for two or three days, and then pause on the submerged joint in a bandage until the place forms a crust.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that one with a poultice inward so that it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you want, make those some burning medicines which I have written about in the twelve treatises of burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	One cautery with iron is according to this way: ignite for cautering which this is the form.
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called "claus clavilhs", because the head of it is thus formed like a nail in which there is some curvature, and in the middle place of it there is a small prominence.

And if the quantity of it which is burned by the thickness of the code is thus as much as its greatness, and hold your hand so that the artery is not burned which is beneath, so that no flux of blood comes.

And then embibe the joint in salt water and pause that on the place, and leave that for three days; and then pause the joint wrapped in a bandage, and then cure with a poultice inward so that it is healed.

Capitol quart.	Fourth chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of old migrating humors.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os. Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme. Capitol .vi.	Chapter six.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of gout.

E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the area where it is described in the process until it is healed.

Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the Cauterization of Old Tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the vessels are old and accumulated and through the veins and arteries which are in the manifest place of the head before, and it is verified that this is a superfluous flux of phlegmatic matter, then cauterize that with a pointed cautery which we have recounted in the chapter of the commencement of watering caused by the vessels, and cauterize in the middle of the head and with two cauteries on both temples, and with two cauteries behind both bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you indicate an addition, then cauterize that on the entire side of the vessel above the extremity of the eyebrow with a small pointed cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the Cauterization of Foul Odor of the Nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you medicate that with water which we have said in the division and does not perfect your medication, then prepare and give in drinking to the patient three nights; and raise his head, and cauterize that with a pointed cautery more gentle than an olive-tree cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that with a keyed cautery and two cauteries on both eyebrows behind the hair, a little.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of the artery that you do not injure it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And of the keyed cautery, this is the method.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the Cauterization of Softening of the Eyelids of the Vessels.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the vessel is softened by illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery of this lunar cautery; and this is its form.
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that above both eyebrows a little with two cauteries in the entire partition, and then they will be elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but rather according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the Cauterization of the Eyelid of the Vessel when the skin is converted to the internal parts and punctures the vessel.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the vessel is converted to the internal parts and punctures the vessel, cauterize in those places according to two manners, because either it is with iron or it is with combustible medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize with fire, command the patient to hold still that which reads the six skin layers thus as those which are worldly, until they are prolonged and enlarged; and if you puncture that which deviates from its proper place, then strengthen the vessels of him with a band so that it is not moved until the skin is born.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Since they are born and enlarged, then pause the head of the patient in the same place, and place a sign above the eyelid of the vessels of him with a tent, and signal that which is according to the figure of the leaf of myrtle, and it is the commencement of the proper signal of the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then pause with cotton in a bundle of wool or in a mucilage of ptilly above the vessel.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then ignite the cautery of which this is its form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize above the figure which has been signified, little by little, in well-ordered motions, until the surface of the neck is combusted, which is thus as a leaf of myrtle, totally appearing properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the signal of sanitation of the entire work is that you see the eyelid of the vessel already contracted and the skin of him elevated from the puncture of the vessel.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then lift your hand and leave it there for three days, and place a poultice on the affected area so that the wound may be healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then take care to apply an ointment inside so that it may be healthy.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	Sometimes it returns to the skin for some reason, and then the eyelid is softened, so do another application of the cautery on the entire area, just as you had done previously.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	Sometimes the skin is on the eyelid below, then cauterize that inside so it may be elevated to its natural place and be enclosed, and the skin does not puncture the vein.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	Sometimes the cautery is a burning medicine that commands the patient to lift the skin inside so it may be prolonged and enclosed, and then make a paper template in the shape of a leaf of mint.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take soap made from congealed goose fat and living snake's water. I think there might be a mistake! The text you provided doesn't seem to make sense in the context of medieval medicine. So here's the water, and then mix those causes well, and make that into a fermentation so it may not be frozen; and then spread it over the paper which was made thus in the shape of mint leaves, and place it on one vein of both arms; and place below the vein, enclosed in albumen of egg white, and the head of the patient should be in the same position.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the finger on the medicine and apply a little of it, not too much, so that the patient feels the biting sensation of the medicine, because the biting sensation is in it just like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And then as you will perceive that the bitter sensation is gone, then remove the medicine and wash your fingers; then as the biting sensation ceases, then remove the medicine and wash the vein with water; and then consider if sometimes the eyelid has been lifted thus as it has been washed away from the constriction of fire or incision, because then it will be; and if it does not return to that place where the medicine was not applied and is not denied until the operation is enclosed and the vein is constricted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place on the affected area with a poultice in order to eradicate the root of the inflammation, and then take care to apply an ointment or another remedy so that it may be healthy.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, because of your operation, to keep diligent vigilance so that the remedy does not fall on the vein, and if the eyelid becomes softened after several days and some cause of the skin punctures the vein, then repeat your medicine on the place where the eyelid was softened, and properly thus as it was done at the beginning, and then apply it inside so that it may be healthy.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of mint leaves.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the veins of men are diversified according to magnitude and smallness, and thus according to this, your contraction is made.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And it will not be confused the way of direct treatment with that which was studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery of fistula that is in the tear duct of the vein.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure a fistula with water that we have spoken of in the divisions of the diseases and do not confuse your cure, then it is necessary that you cauterize it in this manner: command the patient to place their head thus in the same position, and hold the head of some minister between the thighs in such a way that it may not be moved nor agitated by the seated head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place the poultice infused with egg white or in a mucilage of ptilli over the vein of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cautery of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be conical, thus as it is in the shape of a reed or a point of a wing, from one extremity to which the cautery was made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it should penetrate inside to the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out thus as you intended.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	Sometimes the emperor orders that which is cooked is better for the entire work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then take the fistula if it is opened, and draw out the bloody serum and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not opened, then operate on it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place on the vein the cautery which was well ignited, and you have that in your hand a little away from the cautery of the vein at the bridge of the nose, so that it does not err with your hand or the patient is not disturbed, and then place the cautery in the grooves of the vein and corrupt it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then at the beginning of the vein cautery, it is seen to enter into the bone; well; and if not, then repeat the cautery one or two times, if necessary; and leave it thus for three days, and then place on that affected area with a poultice and enclose it in an ointment exsiccated inside so that it may be healthy.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If it has been passing eleven days and there is no health, then stop using the sharp corrosive medicine until the bone is discovered and is scraped according to what is convenient in the seventh chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And it is another method of cauterizing the fistula, which previously mentioned doctors: then at the place of the fistula, make a hole and apply a subtle instrument in the shape of it; put in it a quantity of one ounce of melted lead; and hold your hand firmly on it, so that the lead does not penetrate to the hollow of the patient; and be careful to apply it to the hollow of the patient's body or in albumen of egg white or in water, because the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it marvelously.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterizing and treatment, it is good; but if not, then it is necessary to administer a poultice of the nose and reduce the fistula to its proper place in the body of the nose according to how it will come into its own place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the fracture of the toes.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Wounds or cracks that occur in the lips, and especially in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	So when you treat those cracks as we have said in the divisions and do not deepen your treatment, then ignite the small cutting cautery according to this form that is taught.
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And it is the conquest of it according to the subtlety of the scalpel.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place it gently in those cracks until the cautery penetrates to the bottom of the cracks.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with wax until it is healthy.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cauterization of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or in the roots of the teeth there is an aposteme and then it breaks, and then it bursts, and then it becomes chronic, and correct the break and make a fistula, and then you treat it and do not deepen your treatment, then it is necessary to ignite the cautery according to the quantity that is received in the fistula, and then put that ignited thing in the poultice of the fistula, and hold your hand until the iron ignites at the bottom of it, and afterwards make one or two wounds; and then treat it with what we have said about treatment until it is healthy.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the ulcer is abscessed and healed, it is good; but if not, then it is necessary to discover the place and extract the corrupted bone according to how it will come into its own chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and softening of gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicines and do not confide in them, then place the head of the patient in a straight position, and ignite the cautery in the form that will come forth, thus that you place the cotton on the tooth and insert it into the ignited cautery, holding your hand firmly so that the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth to be penetrated.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and then repeat the cautery several times according to how you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should rinse his mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and afterwards spit it out, because the decayed tooth is strengthened and the softened gum is toned up and the corrupted humidity is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by coldness, or if there is cold or worm in it, or does not respond to medical treatment, then cauterize it according to two methods: either cauterize with a cow's horn, or cauterize with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterizing with a cow's horn is to take a cow's horn and boil it in a kettle of iron, and then take it out and wrap it around the extremity of the tongs, and then dip it into the boiled horn, and place it on the aching tooth firmly until it is cooled down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat it several times until the virtue of the fire penetrates to the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip a needle or a thread into the aforementioned horn, and place it on the aching tooth, and place it on the ignited iron until the iron penetrates to the bottom of the conquest of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, be careful with the cauterization by fire that you attend to the quantity of iron or of fire, and it is in the heart of some grossness and the acuteness of the fire does not penetrate to the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery in the form that will come, and place it on the tooth and hold your hand until the cautery is cooled down; and do this several times because the pain will be relieved or on that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And then the patient should receive the impression of that cautery, which will fill their mouth with good odor and hold it for an hour; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	You should cauterize at the point where you feel extreme pain, according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the tube:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of deformed limbs.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When deformed limbs are of a fluid and cold humors and do not obey digestion through medicines and you want the digestion of those lightly, then you ignite the cautery in the form of which is this following, having two hollow extremities to introduce smoke through the cautery into the other extremity, and pause that ignition over that aposteme for a while, and another if it is indicated for that, until it reaches the root of the aposteme.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the aposteme is small, then pause the cautery according to the quantity of the aposteme, and leave it for three days and pause over the inflamed area in good odor until it is removed what the fire has consumed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that wounded limb with tents and dressings until it is healthy.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the form of the tube or of the two cauteries is to be conveyed thus.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of ulcers of the voice and of constrictions of the wings.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity comes over the canal of the lung, and especially when that is with a complexity of completion, then it is necessary for the patient to be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that which is the root of the galleon in the predetermined place.

Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization of diseases of the lung and of coughs.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent. E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	You know that when the arterial flow is healthy, it's not possible to restrict the blood in those cases, and especially when the artery is large, if not one of four manners: either by cautery as I have said, or by extraction when it's not extracted, because when the extremities are burned they are restricted and the blood is restrained, or that it be tied with a tight ligature, or that it be placed on medicinals which virtue is to restrain the blood; and they are strengthened in the pulvinar constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	Maybe he who administers decent restraint of the ligature and structure, and strictures drops or by position of burning causes and similarities, does not compare unless it's bitter.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	Maybe if it happens to be at some point and there is no doctor present or medicine, then work on the aforementioned indication over the orifice of that vein as I have said, and intend to great constriction within so that the blood is stopped from the superior part of the plague, and above the artery it's not rejuvenated; and above the artery it's aspurgated with water frequently of much great frequency within so that the blood is congealed and thickened; and maybe you will find out whether there is need to cautery or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	It begins the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and perforation and vein section and of phlebotomy and of wounds and of their similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the paragraphs of Albucazis.

Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	On the cure of water that is contained in the head of children.

E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And then if the humidity is more augmented and the abscess is larger, then there are two fissures here, according to this method.
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is beneath the bone, it is signified that you always close the commissures of the head, utterly divided from all partition and the water is squeezed out when you comprehend that in the same tie and to the internal parts, and it does not appear to be what you are imagining.

e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	and then extract the entire humidity; and then strengthen the fissures with draps and plasters; and then apply something on top for six days, and then dissolve the liament and cure the plague with tents and poultices, and strengthen the head in equality; and nourish the patient with dry victuals of little humidity until the member is comforted and healthy.
