And stop the blade of that cutter from reaching the adjacent flesh of the cord, and the blade of the lion's tooth does not reach the bone, and fill in what has penetrated to the middle fissure, and dissect all those veins that descend from the head to the heels.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	It is better to continue the incision up to where the cord appears, and then make an incision in the middle fissure into another fissure.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And since the flow of blood is considerable in quantity, express the places of the blood clots that have congaled.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then stop in each hot fissure of the moist cloth, and stop over those swollen pustules that are inflamed with venom and oil, and beware that no aposteme is generated from a bad ulcer.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, apply the ligature and administer a great infusion of hot water or decoction, and then heal with basilicon ointment and rose oil, and other things that are being applied to cure the sores.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the treatment of ulcers caused by catarrh and descending from the divisions of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When there comes catarrh and it continues, and the patient's thighs are somewhat extended, and already their gaze is debilitated, and their eyelids are ulcerated and because of that their skin is affected, and in the front of the head there is acute pain and consequent inflammation, then we know through this accident that the catarrh does not come from many veins of the divisions above, but rather proceeds.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for these is this: order the patient to shave their forehead, and then make an incision in a middle place of the forehead, a small one for the width (and begin with the fissure of the left temple into the right temple; and it should be an incision into the bone; and extend your hand from the lacrimal bones of the temples which are swollen from mastigation), until the bone is exposed.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry all the blood with a sponge or absorbent cloth, and then replace it between the two lips of the fissure with a moist cloth or absorbent linen.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then strengthen underneath with swollen pustules that are inflamed with venom and oil, so that no aposteme is generated from a bad ulcer.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you see that the aposteme has already diminished, then it is necessary to scrub the bone until it reaches the newborn flesh, and then heal with a regiment of desiccative powder which makes the flesh dry, thus as if you take two parts of flour from wheat and four parts of colophony and mix them, and make a plaster and apply it to these sores on the native flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of what falls into the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The total cause that falls into the ears is one of four species, whether it is mineral peyra or a cause similar to peyra, thus as iron and vein, or it is from a plant thus as cinder or fava, or it is a fluxible cause thus as water and venom agree and their semblance, or some beast.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And then when peyra falls into the ear or another similar cause from those causes that do not adjust nor believe in the ear, and stop the ear at the sun, and if it is peyra, then distill it into some oil of violet or sisami, and then administer the extraction of it, and make the stirring with conditi, and open the nostrils to receive the event of stirring.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then stop in the circuit of the ear with some pieces of cloth or wool, and extend the ear to the divisions above, because many evacuated matters are forgotten in these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not evacuated, then administer the extraction of it with the instrument called gesti epicicarios subtle, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is forgotten in the gesti, well; and if not, then administer the extraction of it with an instrument subtle of few duplications.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And then if it is not forgotten for that, then make a canal of silver and introduce the extremity of the canal into the trunk of the ear and close the environment of the canal with wax and oil mollified so that nothing gets in except the canal.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract with the strong ventilation attraction, because many evacuated matters are gathered with water that we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not forgotten in this manner, then take alum bat or prepared vessel apparatus with which the wings are pressed together a small quantity, and stop that at the extremity of the ray, and then envelop it decently paused.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then you will insert that into the tube of the ear to facilitate, and then extract the earwax due to humidity.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	So if it is not forgotten in all the causes that we have recounted, then you will touch that dentated area where an abscess or spasm is developing.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of touching that is to start by cleansing the patient's vein of phlegmatic humor and extracting the blood according to the manner of his vertigo, and then you will make a circle between your fingers and convert the ear towards the upper parts, and find a small fissure in the root of the ear from which the greyness of it is coming out.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And it is the lunar-shaped fissure that leads to the stone, and, the stone being removed, you can then use an appropriate instrument; and then close the fissure at that hour with velocity, and cure it until it is healthy.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause residing in the ear is one of the fats that grows and becomes inflamed, then administer the cure and extraction of it; but if you do not obey your own judgment, then take a subtle spatula according to this form.
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer to that the absorption of that fat which has fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not think that it is humidified by the vapor of the ear, and place it in small pieces, and propose to extract them with the onyches or subtle gestures, or as if by inscizio, as we have said, because the extraction of it is alleviated.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water that has entered into the ear, because the patient uses sternutation at the beginning, and fills the entire ear with a lot of vile matter, and pours over that ear in which there is water, and if it is forgotten, well; and otherwise, then take three or four stones and place them according to the length of the finger, and cauterize them in the focus of a small fire, and the patient inserts one of them into the tube of his ear and sounds above one of the parties and percusses with another stone on the stone that is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	So it does not stop until all the water has been forgotten.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And already the water will be forgotten, and you will take pieces of paper or of cotton. and place one extreme end of it in the ear and extend the other extreme end into the fire until it is burned, the wax of it.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put another cotton and do it so many times until all the water is forgotten, and draw that out with a cannula as it has been said about the extraordinary stone.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of the beast that enters into that ear, if it is a small thing, thus pierce and to its semblance, cure it thus as we have said in the division; but if it is of great size which causes apparition at the sense of the vessel, then administer the extraction of it with gestures and onyches, and the cause of it is more light than all the other causes that occur in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of a worm engendered in the ear, when you cure it with water as we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillations and do not confound your cure, then it is necessary that you expose the ear to sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so if any cause of worms appears here, then extract it with gestures or subtle onyches, but if no cause appears, then take a cannula strongly stretched and amplified from which this is the form of it.
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the subtle extremity into the ear according to the quantity that the patient can bear; and then suck strongly with water for a strong suction, and do it many times, until all the worms are forgotten.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if you do not obey your own judgment, then operate and close in the circuit of the cannula with wax as we have said; then administer distillations which have already been experimented on by the ancients in the cure of worms, and you will find it in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is your effusion which you pour out medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument of which this is the form.
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make that of silver or of copper, strongly stretched, in which there is a small tube, and placed thus.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so it is how they fill what is in the cavity of the cannula, which will be necessary here.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the rod and wrap it decently with wax at the extremity of it, and then put oil in the cavity of the instrument, or juice of some herb, or whatever medicine you want to put in the cannula — and that is in the ear —, and then insert the rod with wax thus and express your hand so that the compression is tempered until the oil is expelled from the cavity of the instrument and the patient feels the oil dripping.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And it is necessary that the auricle be scarified with a small focus.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	Beware that the cause which you distilled in the auricle is not too frequent, because auricle medicines do not suffer it.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the treatment of ulceration of the auricles.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some evacuated ulcers on the sides of the belly of pregnant women are not perforated, and it happens in some homes, ulceration in the flesh of the auricle due to a plague or carnal wound; and this ulceration is made in the preceding trauma of the auricle which does not consent to healing, and some evacuated ulcers are on the outer parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the preceding trauma of it, which does not consent to healing, is in the major dispositions of difficult sanitation.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that which follows, you should pause the auricle of the patient towards the sun and regard it in that.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then if an apparent suppuration occurs, observe carefully with a subtle spatula the form of it:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of it is where the latitude is small, of which one part is acute and the other not; and the spatula should be of two gentle lengths so that it does not cause harm to the auricle.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And then if the ulceration is born from flesh in the auricle or in its flesh, then you should make subtle incisions and vigorously facilitate entry so that all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the ulceration is in the preceding trauma of the auricle, then take a subtle razor and scalpel that place with a small focus, and then put it in the flesh of the auricle.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And then if you have sensed suppuration in that which the patient's atrophy has facilitated, due to the gravity of absorption, it forces the oppression of it to be facilitated; and beware that you do not harm the nerves of the auricle.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then pause on the auricle, drap it with linen according to the quantity of the width of the bandage which you have enveloped in Egyptian unguent; and do this for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the plague; or take some water and pour it into a bowl and pulverize over the bandage and use it to anoint; and if the auricle is about to be apostemated, then beware that you extract the water and permute it with another water which you have enveloped in cerate so that it is done with roasted oil, until it is apostemic caution; and then cure it until it is healthy.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	Moreover, if a flow of blood occurs, then submerge a sponge or cloth in cold water and pause it on the auricle, and use another cure which restricts the flow of blood, which is stated in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the treatment of athelia which occurs in the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athelia which occurs in the eyelids of some eyes is humid, some evacuated ulcers are dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Then beware that you hold those with tenacious or pointed nails, and sharpen them to the root of their roots, and then pause on the affected places thoroughly.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	Moreover, if pain with a flow of blood comes, then you should cauterize those with a subtle lancet-like cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is to pause on the incisions and too evacuated ulcers that return when some cause of their roots remains; and when they are cauterized in focus, those roots are consumed and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment of cataracts that come to the eyelids of the eyes.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Some evacuated motes dwell in the eyelids of the eyes for some cause which is assembled to grandeur in its strength and hardness, and thus grandeur is appealed.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an addition of gross humidity in the upper eyelid and underneath.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Then the operation on them is that you consider then if the grandeur is proceeding in it from what appears of the eyelid and is magnified to the whole part; and the cause of it is lassitude.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Then make a fissure above it for the width, and then scrape it from the whole part to facilitate evacuation, and then suspend it with a pointed instrument and absolve it.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	Moreover, if you have not prepared the incision of it, then do not push so that it penetrates the eyelid with an incision little by little, then that will not be noticed in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you adjust it with a suture; and cure it until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not overcome evil through that because the unction of it restores and incarnates.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the grandeur is declining to the deep parts of the eyelid, then you will evacuate the eyelid and suspend the grandeur with a pointed instrument, unless you indicate an incision, and prepare it from the whole part, and if the eyelid by incision is elongated, that will not be noticed in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the treatment, wash the wound with salt water; and take care of the area where the disease is entrenched so that it may be healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	About the treatment of abscesses under the eyelid.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Abscesses are grayish in color which are generated in the membranes of the eyelid, and they increase especially in children, aggravate the eyes of those who have them, and cause them to avoid the brightness of the sun because of the pain that is felt by them.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And for this reason you will often see them shading their eyes all the time, and sleeping with their eyelids half-closed, which have been covered in inflammation, and there is a threat of apparent aggravation in the eye; and when you press on the area around the veins, you feel the aggravation entering into it.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And some manner of operation is in that which the patient pauses his evil humor in the vein, and then pause to draw off the fluid and of the hot circle, according to the quantity it contains of arthritic matter from the whole affected part, and then pause to apply it to the area and press on the veins of the entire circumference, and then finish in the middle of that humidity at a certain point incident in the fissure, and the fissure is not larger than the one made in phlebotomy.
