Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recounted, in the division, of the species of hydropsy of water, and the signs of each species, of the cure of it with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is cured with iron is not but the species of solitary altitudes, and it does not approach with iron to the species of timpanists nor to the species of hypochondriacs, because it is mortal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	When you have medicated this species of hydropic timpanistre with medicines and do not combine your medication, then consider, because if the patient has already achieved debilitation, or it is another hydropic malady, thus as if it is in the whole body or belly and seems similar to those, then beware that you do not medicate with iron, because fear is above all.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	Perhaps sometimes the patient has an exuberant vertigo, and it is not another malady but only hydropic, and neither infant nor old, then the manner of the operation for him is that you elevate the patient between your hands, and the minister places his extreme hand on the belly, inserting the water at the part below the navel, and then takes spathic spinning according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It is of two acute long parts, of acute extremity thus as spathic; perhaps however it is in some brief small brevity little by little, so that in the operation he does not pass into the intestine, and that leads him.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the generation of hydropic is from parts of the intestines, because then it behoves that you have the section tied to the navel for the quantity of three digits below, in the direction of the belly above the navel.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	Perhaps if the generation of hydropic is due to malady of the liver, then your section should be on the left side of the navel for three digits.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation of it is due to the mixing, then your section should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And it does not behove that your section should be on the rib over which you want to transfer the malady so that the superfluous fluids do not flow to that free location.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then perforate with the entire instrument the cisterna, and then insert into that section, and elevate your hand with the spathic between the cisterna and the siphac, and you excoriate it; and if the quantity of an ounce or around.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then perforate the siphac until the spathic reaches the desired location, and it is the place of the water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then extract that and insert an instrument of which this is the form:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a subtle silver cannula; it is made of silver or copper or golden lion, at the lower part of which there is a small tube, and on its sides there are three tubes: two from one part and one from the other part; and it is fashioned in the extremity of the instrument according to the manner of a feather, thus sometimes.
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And in the extremity of the instrument there is a small ring, because when the instrument reaches the water, then it suddenly descends upon the instrument, and evacuates the water at that time in a moderate quantity, because if you evacuate more than that, it does not behove at that hour, for the evil spirit of the animal would be resolved, or it would hasten towards the fifth crisis which is approaching death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	Perhaps evacuate that according to the quantity of the vertigo of the patient and according to what the dispositions of the malady of the vertigo of the pulse of the patient and its goodness signify to you.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then extract the instrument, and retain the water which causes it because suddenly it is retained by the cisterna which retains the tube that is above the siphac, of which I recommend to you that you perforate it according to this manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then iterate the instrument another day if the patient tolerates it, and extract a small quantity of water, and do that for some days above fear, and beware of error so that you do not remain with too much water.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	Perhaps if you fear about the patient, and leave a great quantity of water, then cure that one who is buried in hot sand, and move him to a bath, and expose him to the sun for a long time; and cure that one with desiccative medicines until he is healthy.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize upon the stomach, and the mixing and the liver, according to the extraction of water, as I have recounted in what has been said previously.
Capitol .lv.	The end.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	On the cure of children whose urinary places are not perforated.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Some weakened children are thus from the belly of their mother and the head of their mixture is not perforated (or has a narrow tube or is not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Then it behoves to cauterize the perforation of the patient as soon as he is born with a subtle spathic according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then pause in the tube a small key of lead and tie it, and you for three days or for four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when he wants to urinate, it is retained and held back; and then return that.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not stop the flow, it is possible that the urine which goes to the area will not be cleared from this closure.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	Maybe that of which the stricture is straight should be medicated with key of Flow, thus as we have said, for thirty days until it is amplified.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	Maybe those in which the stricture is not in its place, so led to, which causes because of those, that which is born and the trau is deprived of the end of the head of the rod because it cannot urinate at the divided parts, until it elevates the rod with its hand at the divided parts below; and it is not for generation, for thus because the sperm cannot reach the womb according to rectitude, and it is a great malady.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the manner of the operation on him is that the patient should be seated on his back, and then extend the head of the rod with your left hand in a vehement extraction, and insert the head of the rod into the area of the perineum with a spatula, thus as it is inserted like a feather, or you do not touch any part, so that the mien of the rod seems to be at the head of the rod and the stricture falls into its proper place according to need.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And beware that in your operation of blood flow, because many times it happens to stop; and pause at the moment when it absorbs the blood, and cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter 6.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	About the white ulcer that occurs on the perineum at the head of the rod and of corrosion and blackness and adhesion of the perineum at the head of the rod.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many times it happens that this white ulcer occurs on the rod and it is a sign of great carnal weakness.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And of those, one is malignant and another is non-malignant.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	Non-malignant, it is necessary that you suspend with a subtle unguent and absorb it until it disappears completely; and then pause over the underlying skin, submerging it in Egyptian ointment; and then, cure the wound daily with finicon ointment until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the ulcer is malignant, of bad color, then it is necessary that you administer cautery at the insertion of it and its root.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	Maybe if the ulcer is on the perineum of the head of the rod in an uncircumcised person, and one part of the ulcer is inside the perineum and another part is outside, then it is necessary that you remove the ulcer which is inside from the beginning until it is consolidated; and then you cure the outer one, because when you cure the inner one, it is not assured that it will not be troubled.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And also it happens in the genitals and on the perineum with blackness and corruption, therefore it is necessary that you conquer all that which has been denounced and that which wants to corrupt or that which is corrupted; and then apply liniments over that with good millet flour of scorched wheat and of errors, trissatz and crivellatz.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And then cure it with another treatment until it is healthy.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	Maybe if there is a flow of blood, then administer lunar cautery according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	because juvenile cautery is in two dispositions at the same time, thus it is a flow of blood and a wound when it is corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the rod is corroded and is destroyed entirely at that hour, then it is necessary that you introduce into the middle of the perineum a tube of lead so that the patient urinates through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the perineum to the head of the rod (and this adhesion does not happen except in those whose perineum is sound, and on it no circumcision is performed; and when adhesion occurs due to wound or apostema) it is necessary that you scrape with a blunt spatula until the ligament is dissolved and the head of the rod is liberated from all parts.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to disentangle those exquisite things, then it is necessary that you scrape with a spatula for some cause of the head of the rod and of the perineum, and thus it is because the perineum, when it is subtle, is easily perforated by its subtlety.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And then separate between the perineum and the head of the rod with a subtle drizzle of liquid, which has been softened in warm water so that they do not adhere again another time.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then it is cured with a seven-step treatment until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter 7.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	About the purification of children and the cure of what happens to those who are circumcised.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution of continuity thus as the other wounds: maybe emperor with our operation and our will, and those of that are properly in the children, it is necessary that we assign to them a better operation and a more gentle way to preserve their health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore, I say that the ancients did not practice circumcision in any of their free laws, because they did not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired it through experimentation, which causes the majority of artisans and barbers to use circumcision and purification with novacula and torores; and they used ligament with faith and insertion into the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	You have already gone through all these manners and do not get bewildered by the various mixtures of medicines, because in the mixture there is a similarity with the onguent, since many times the coding of the prepuce to two tunics, and Roman tonic is added afterwards, and it is strengthened by another inscription and sure pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And in the mundification which is made by alphabetic, and it is digital, of which the saboteurs make use, it is not insured the inscription on the extremity of the virile member, because it enters strongly into its tract.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	Maybe in the operation on the nail, you strongly obstruct iron and corrupt your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the coding of the infant is brief by nature, and many times it is seen in such a manner that there is no need for mundification, and you have seen that.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	Maybe from the mundification that is made with onguents and lamentations of fiel, goodness, experiment describes it to me, because the onguents are of proportional inscription, for which the acuitation that is below is also as the acuitation that is above; and thus as you press your hand so proportionally two acuitations, and inscribe them according to a comparison in one time; and it is made with compression of fiel in a figure containing the coding of the whole partition, in which there is no chance of error.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the manner of the first operation is that you make the infant stay in a major position if it is one of those who understand a little, so that you do not do anything but place the fiel on its verge only, and that you let it enter into another day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then make that rejoice in all that manner which is as much as possible for you to receive its intelligence.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then make that stay between your hands, well prepared and established, and do not let it be seen; and hide the onguents in your hand or near the foot, so that the infant does not see them nor any other of the instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And then insert your hand into its verge and blow on the coding, and pull it out so that the head of the verge is seen, and then mundify that which is added to it with filth.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And then tie the marked place with double fiel, and then tie below that one small ligature according to the lament, and then tell me at the said place and indicate the place of the lament below in good retention, and inscribe between two laments.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then elevate the coding above the ligature and extract the head of the verge; and then let the blood flow little by little, because it is better; and pause powdered dust above and on the powdered dust pause a drap in which there is spread a mixture of oil extracted from various herbs, recently roasted and boiled; and let that be above until another day; and care for that with curative intent until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The form of the onguents for mundification, this is the form:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Some of the extremities are not-taloned and others are taloned, so that the branch of the nail is not seen, and it is the length of the two acuitations also as the length of two manual handles in harmony.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	Maybe the error in mundification is because you strongly effuse the internal coding entirely, or part of it deviates from the inscription.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore, I suppose that you extend that of your hour at your nail before the apostemation of the place and that you inscribe it according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it at your nail, then extract it in a hook and inscribe it.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	Maybe if three days have passed, and Roman water that is inflated below the apostematized verge, then you let it enter until the apostema is cooled, and excavate that which is facilitated, and inscribe it according to your preparation.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And beware of the head of the verge, because it will not hurt at that water.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And then care for that with water that the plague consolidates from the powders which we have recommended in the treatise on powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is inscribed from the coding according to measure, and you obey the parts below, that does not bother at all.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And maybe care for that with water that we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter 48.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	On the cure of retained urine in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is made by obstruction made by stone or by congealed blood, or by poisons or by wounds, and it seems similar to those of water that we have said about the manners of cure in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved, and there is retention of it being by stone which already is in the neck of the bladder, then I suppose that the patient is encumbered over the sick kidneys.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And then combine the feet of that one over the sick kidneys and extend the sick belly from the part above the sick kidneys, and the patient stretches the sick wings as much as possible.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, when the bladder's neck is constricted, it hinders the expulsion of urine into the rear parts, so that the urine is absorbed.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved in water that we have said is vehemently made into the cause above the patient, then it is necessary to administer an extraction of it with an instrument called a syringe, of which this is the form: It should be of silver and its conical end should be subtle, like a thin cane of a reed, in similarity to a palm and half, at whose tip it should be subtle.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of examining the urine is that you should take the folded thread and place it in the extremity of the wool or cotton for good liaison; and insert the extremities of the thread into the rear part of the syringe, and push them into the forked tips if there is any superfluous cause in the wool, but introduce it into the cane with vehemence. And then place the syringe in a bowl and album of urine.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient sit on a chair, and enclose the bladder of theirs and the verge with olive oil and anoint it, and anoint it with olive oil and oils.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then introduce the syringe to facilitate entry into the root of the bladder; and then double the bladder from below at the part of the naval; and then fill the syringe with that; and then fill it so that it reaches the bladder, and then the patient is reached by the cause, and it is not done in this order, but rather the meat on which it goes to tortuousness.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then stretch out the thread into the small wool little by little, because the urine dries the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then extract that and make a cure for urine, and use a syringe, do not cease to evacuate the water and use the syringe until the bladder and the patient are greatly alleviated.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter 6.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	On the quality of evacuation of the bladder with a clamp and similar instruments which are adapted to water.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When there is an ulceration or abscess in the bladder, or it is constricted with gangrene, or it is obstructed by poyredura, and you want to distill waters and medicines into it, then it is necessary to make an instrument called a clampcedra, and this is its form:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	but rather that at the extremity of it is a hole, so it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in it there are three channels: two from one part, and sometimes more.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning it is a concave place, in which there is water that is imprisoned, and it is according to the quantity that oppiles that, its addition, until when some cause is withdrawn from the humidity, it is withdrawn, and when it is expelled, with water it is withdrawn, and when it is expelled long, according to what makes the clampcedra in which there is phicated naptha in the battles of the sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, when you want to draw humidity into the bladder, introduce the extremity of the clampcedra into the humidity, and withdraw with that water which is imprisoned in the lower parts, because the humidity is withdrawn into the cavity of the clampcedra.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then introduce the extremity of the clampcedra into the bladder according to what we have recommended in the syringe; and then fill the humidity with that water which fills, because that humidity passes through to the bladder at once, and the patient feels it.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	The form of the subtle crystallizer in which the bladder is crystallized, and this is its form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is made of silver or copper, of which the head is so subtle that it seems like a small feather, and below it has a hollow tube.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And then take the bladder in motion, and pause in it the humidity that you want to crystallize in the bladder, and then tie it between two strong ligatures with a double thread, and heat that humidity over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then introduce the extremity of the crystallizer into the bladder.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then strengthen your hand over the bladder with the humidity in structured descent until the patient feels that the humidity has already passed into the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you are not present at the bladder, then take a piece of parguames and make it into that circle; and perforate it with all its returned totality; and then introduce a strong thread into those channels, as they are revolved; and then add the circle as it is added also to the softness, so that you pause in that water which you want from the humidities, and oils and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tie that to the instrument and make it as it is made in the bladder, and express it with your hand until the humidity passes into the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter 10.
De extraccio de peyra.	On the extraction of stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already spoken in the division of the species of stone and its cure with medicines, and the difference between stone generated in the kidneys and stone generated in the bladder, and their signs.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said that the patient must be placed in a chair where they can operate with their hand, and assist them.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	The chair prepared in the bladder properly is that which is fixed in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And you already know how to make a clear and brief exposition.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	So it is said that the chair prepared in the bladder mostly goes to the children; and of its signs are that the urine that is issued from the bladder is similar to water in its subtlety, and appears in that arena; and the patient feels his rod, and many veins are felt, and it is properly dressed; and I know for certain that the anus is open in many of those.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is the healing of the children's health from that age that they have reached fourteen years; and it is difficult to cure in the veins.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	More often in the young ones it is worse because it occurs among them.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that one whose chair is greater and the cure is more difficult; And if it is slight, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	So when we come to the cure of that, it is necessary at the beginning of that which we modify the patient with Christ's cross, which extracts all the filth that is in their sick veins; because that filth prohibits the descent of the chair, and the inquiry of it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then be near the patient with their feet elevated and constricted, and held in a way that the chair descends to the region of the bladder, or that it jumps from place to some veins.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then make that circle between your prepared hands, and his hands are placed under the hips of him, so that the whole bladder is made to decline towards the lower parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then seek out that and all that defect.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	So if you feel the chair in the space, then you will find it immediately with assistance over him.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not find the whole of it at once, then it is necessary that you anoint with olive oil the said finger of the left hand, if the patient is a child, or the said finger if he is a young adult, and insert it into his anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And seek out the chair until it stays under the said finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And convert that little by little into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And then press above that with the said finger, and expel it to the lower parts before you see the place where you will assist.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the minister to press the bladder with his hand; and command another minister to stretch out his right hand towards the upper parts, and hold his other hand under the codena which is below the genitals, in the place where the assistance is made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then insert the spatula beneath the incident of which this is the form of it:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and you separate it in the water that is between the anus and the genitals, not in the middle place, beside the side of the left hip; and be the assistance on that chair and the said finger is in the anus, and make transverse assistance, so that the assistance from before is wide and direct, according to the quantity that you feel of the chair being possible, and no more, because you will compress the said finger which is in the anus the chair from which the assistance is forgotten, and it is often difficult.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And you know that of the chair there are some which have an angle and margins, because the evacuation of it is made difficult for that.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of that water it is like a lion similar to a globe, and it is round, and it makes the easier evacuation.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	So if it is that one which has angles and margins, adjust it in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not forgotten, then it is necessary that you lean over that, or that you strengthen over that with decent gestures, the extremity of which is like a lime on which you strengthen over the chair, and do not evacuate from it; or that you insert below the subtle instrument of curved extremity.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	More often if you cannot reach that, then you amplify the tract a little, and if you see flux of blood, separate it with strong vinegar triturated.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	More often if the chair is more of one, then at the beginning you push the hand into the mouth of the bladder, and then insert it over him; and then push a little more water; and similarly make many movements.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if it is a very large chair, then ignorance is that you insert it with great assistance, because it harms the patient for one of two causes: either he dies or he becomes accustomed to the continuous distillation of urine, because the place is not totally consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	More often administer expulsion of it until it is forgotten, or insert into the fracture of it with the forceps until it extracts that in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	So when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with enemas of aloe and dragon's blood, and strengthen it.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And stop on that damp cloth infused in oil and wine, or in oil rubbed with water, so that the postema's heat may be calmed.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	Then restore the patient to their bed, and do not discharge the bandage until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when the aura is discharged, anoint the area with water and much oil, and then take care to heal that wound with diamond-like remedies and dibasilicon remedies until it is healthy.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	Sometimes in the plague, postema heat is accidentally adjusted, and corrosive, and of that same sort as if the blood is congealed in the bladder, and therefore urine is prohibited (and that is known through the egress of the blood in the urine), so then insert the warm tieu in the plague and extract that blood, because it remains to provoke the bladder to corruption of the bladder and its putrefaction.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the plague with wine, water and salt, and apply opposition to all species, with that which is convenient for the cure until it is healthy.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And take care in all hours of the entire cure that you read to both thighs and adjust the medicines which are placed on the area.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and it is in the middle of the bladder, and it is fixed in it, and urination is prohibited, then cure it with what you have recommended beforehand so that you may pass through to section, because many times veiled passages are accused of section; and already you have spread out this, and it is that you take a perforator of iron alloy, of which this is the form:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	of triangular extraction, pointed, fixed in a shaft.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And then take a thread, and tie it to that which holds the bladder beneath the stone so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And then insert the iron into the bladder, perforating with facility until the perforator reaches that stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And turn the perforator with your hand in that small stone little by little, and you perform the perforation of it until you make that from the other part penetrate; because the urine will then be absoluted.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And then place your hand on that which is remaining of the stone from the part before the bladder, because it is triangular, and it is forced out with the urine, and the patient is healthy.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	Sometimes this cure is not adapted for some cause that prohibits it, then tie a thread beneath the stone, and another thread above the stone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And then incise over the stone in that bladder between two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And then extract it.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And then discharge the bandage and clarify the congealed blood, which is done in the plague.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to have a bandage of thread beneath the stone, but so that it does not return to the bladder, and the other bandage above, because when the thread is discharged, the stone returns to its place and takes away the plague.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And therefore it is necessary to have the thread above, that you elevate the stone to the parts above, or that it returns with the warm compliment, and takes away the plague thus as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter 16.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	On the extraction of stone from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	A stone in women is rarely generated.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	Sometimes a stone appears in some of them, then the cure of it is difficult, and it is prohibited by many methods.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is because the woman's bladder is weak.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is because you do not find a woman who knows how to describe her own measurements to the doctor when it is cast, or they are of the women having husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is because you do not find a woman who knows this art, mainly the operation with her hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the place of section over stone in women is longer than the place of the stone, because it requires a deeper section, and in that there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	Sometimes it is necessary to provoke you to this, then take care that you find a wise woman who knows how to operate, and few are skilled.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	Sometimes you are deprived of this, then seek a wise and subtle woman, or present a mature woman who is skilled in the affairs of women, or a woman who in this art has parted from the art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Then make that present, and command to it that it does all that you will order, from the inquiry about the stone to the beginning; which cause is that it takes care if the woman is weak, then take care that you put the instrument in its rear and extract the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Then if it is extracted, cut that beneath the instrument, and then command to it that it incises over that.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	Sometimes if it is not weak, then command the matron to insert the instrument into the hole of the patient and inquire about the stone, because she places her left hand on the bladder, and comprehends that with good comprehension.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore, when you touch that, then it is good to gradually evacuate the noxious matter from the bladder to the parts below, as it is a sign of its virtue entering into that through the narrow passage of the thigh.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And then place a compress on that affected area of the thigh, where it is constricted by the narrow passage of the thigh, and bind the stone in that part, and do not let it be removed from the stone, which is constricted below.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the section should be small at the beginning; and then insert the rod into that section, and if you feel the stone, then adjust the section according to the quantity which you think the stone will be extracted from there.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And you should know that the types of stones are many: some are small and large, and rough, sharp, long and round, and have ridges.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Then you know how many types of stones there are from that which you signify above what you want.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see a flow of blood, adjust the vitriol-treated location and apply it for an hour until the blood is absorbed, and then return to your operation until the stone is forgotten.

E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	And then place the hand on the codena of the testicles at the front parts, and also extend the white liver with its hand on the left side, and raise the hole to the liver at the section part; and command the minister to extend the hole downwards and you dissolve the adherence which is behind in a complete solution.
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And search with the fingers to see if there is any cause of the intestine wrapped around the white liver.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you find some cause of it, then you will fill that into the belly beneath.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And then you take a needle in which there are eleven thick threads of ten threads, and introduce it into the back of the liver, which is beneath the codena of the testicles, which is the section; and then insert the extremities that emerge from the thread until they are four threads, and then compose some of them over some figure in the manner of a cross; and bind it to the liver of which we have spoken, that is beneath the codena of the testicles with strong binding of two parts.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And then envelop the extremities of the threads and bind them with strong binding until some of the veins that do not irrigate those cannot transmit any cause, so that from here no apostema can occur.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And pause another evacuated binding according to the first binding, a long time of three days; and then these two bindings will be from the liver which is beneath the codena of the testicles, as much as the greatness of the finger, and insert all the remaining roundness, and remove from there the hole.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And then insert into the part beneath the codena of the testicles for sectioning of that which will run with health and sanity, thus as we have recommended in what we have said.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And then administer the submerged lancet in oil, and pause in the plague; and administer the binding which we have recommended (and some evacuated matters of the white liver are cauterized, which we have said to administer with the insertion of the tempered flux of health, because many evacuated matters accumulate there) and release the binding until it falls by itself.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if the treatment of that is delayed, then the hot water should be applied, and pause over it until it falls according to what we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the plague with another cure of plagues until it is healthy.

De hernia ventosa.	Of windy hernia.
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia, nothing has been seen that it has been hardened under the cure of that with iron.

Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter 67.
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	About the disruption that is caused in the veins.
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Some bruised areas end up in rupture of the veins, as we have said, and empty the area.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And do not attribute to the genitals any cause of the intestines to the genitals; and if you do, it is little; and return to it in all hours.

But if the time is prolonged in this way, an adjusted fissure is made in the sigmoid colon so that it expels the intestine from the sigmoid colon; and this occurs for the extension of the sigmoid colon which is in the veins, as we have said, which causes the sigmoid colon to be stretched out, and then it becomes soft and putrid at the area and empties.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And the treatment of it is with a cautery, as it was preceded by the narration of it.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And some bruised areas are cured in this way: the patient lies on their back between their two hands, and then dry the area of the rupture of the abscesses empties itself by draining according to the quantity of three digits.

E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And then kiss the two prominent areas above the extremity of the radish of the sigmoid colon, and adjust one to the suture with the other.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then extract the extremity of the radish, and do not insert into the entire sigmoid colon, nor extend the hole, nor any other cause, as you will know in the cure of intestinal hernia.

And then heal it with the cure of wounds, and as you insert the threads, purify it and restore the wound until it is consolidated; because the sigmoid colon is constricted and not adjusted to the prominence of rupture.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cautery is better in this place, because it is more suitable for health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter 68.
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	About the softening of the codeine of the testicles.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Many bruised areas of the codeine of the testicles in some men are softened by this, because the flesh that is between them is softened, and it is necessary to observe their condition.

Capitol .lxix.	Chapter 69.
De castracio.	About Castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	I know that castration is forbidden in our law, but because of the cause I am forced to remember it in this book; and it is not necessary to remember it except for two reasons, one of which is that it is in the science of the doctor when he is expert in that, who knows the cure of it which occurs; and the other reason is that we often need castration of other animals for our young ones, such as of horses, and of goats, and of pigs, and similar to those animals.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is done in two ways: either by attrition, or by making a fissure for drainage.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	Moreover in that which is done by attrition, the method of the operation is that we make the animal drink hot water until its genitals are softened and relaxed and hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take them with your hand until they are resolved and do not appear below the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	Moreover in castration done by making a fissure and drainage, it is necessary that you hold the animal and press the codeine of its testicles with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And then tie the supporters, and insert above each hole in one drainage until two holes are processed.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then insert them with a tube so that some excretion is purified.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not leave any cause on the sigmoid colon, but rather the subtle sigmoid colon which is above the veins.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And in this way of castration it is better which is done by attrition, because attrition strongly loosens any cause of the testicles so that the animal desires to mate.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And then heal the wound until it is healthy.
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter 70.
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	About the cure of Hermaphrodite disease.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphrodite disease in men is according to two ways: one is because it appears in that which occupies the space in the codeine of testicles, in which there are two testicles, forming a figure like a woman's flesh.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And certain evacuated matters of that corr urine which are in the codes of the testicles.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	In women, it is a species: and it is that the womb of the woman over the perineum is also like two testicles of a man, a little smaller in all miniatures, beforehand like the perineum of a man and two testicles.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the treatment is of three species: of two of men and of one species of women.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And it is that you should cover those adjusted meats within so that they expel the impression of that, and then that you cure them with the treatment of the other plagues.

Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	On obstructions and prominent flesh caused by women's affairs.

Capitol .lxxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio de alratica.	On the treatment of gout.
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	Gout is when the womb of the woman is not perforated, or has a small passage.
E es o natural o accidental.	And it is either natural or accidental.
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	Accidental is due to badness which has preceded, and that is made or for flesh not adjusted or for subtle or specific ciphers.
E es fayt o en le preon de la mayre, o en les costatz de lu, o en le pus sobira de lu, o en le pus bas de lu, e prohibeys de cuoyt e de enprenguacio e de enfantament, e fort leu prohibeys las mestruas. E es que pauses sobre las doas labias pulvils, e aprop pausa les tieus ditz indicz de amdoas las mas encemps.	And it is that which pauses over the two pubic labia, and then pauses the threads or indices of both hands in the midst.

Mays si la oppilacio es per carnada, lahoras suspen aquela am unci, e inscideys aquela.	But if the obstacle is due to flesh, then suspend it with a hook, and insert it.
E sian am tu las medicinas que fan cessar flux de sanc ses mordicacio, ayssi cum ahacatia, e sanc de drago, e enses, ajustat am album de huou. Capitol .lxxiii.	Chapter 23.
De la cura de emorroydas e de tayl e de botor roja que accideysso en le conh de las femnas.	On the cure of hemorrhoids and of tile and of red botch that are born in the womb of women.

E si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, fay adherir am dos ventozas, e a las mamilhas ses escarificatio.	And if the blood is abscessed, well; and if not, make adhere to two ventoses, and to the nipples their scarification.

And then take wool and submerge it in juice of colic root or juice of arnaglossa or juice of guarrivier with wine, and make adhere to the place; and then cure the place until it is whole again.
Mays athyl rog le qual es de aspre reguardament, cove que tu inscidas aquo que a tu appar de aquel segon que he dit en theyl engualment.	Those who have asperous regard, it is fitting that you inject that which appears to you according to what I said in the whole treatment.
E cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And cure that until it is whole again.
Capitol .lxxiv.	Chapter 74.
De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	On the accidental perforation of a hernia in the mother.
Motas specias de apostemas accideysso en la mayre, ayssi cum cranc e apostema lapident e ulceracios e adhubelat e erpetromens e fistulas emorroyas e raguarrias e thyl e autres apostemas.	Various special types of abscesses that occur in the mother, such as cancer and malignant apostema, and ulcerations and adherences and eruptions and hemorrhoids and ragworts and thigh and other abscesses.

Therefore it is fitting that you consider if the pain of the abscess in the sick beginning is acute with percussion and fluctuation and fever, and sometimes it increases and feels sentiment upon it, then do not touch the perforation of it, and cure it with what helps on the maturation until the acuteness of the accidents ceases.
E lahoras cove que tu fassas cezer la femna sobre una cezelha que aia doas cezelhas; e recline sobre le sieu dos e ajusta les sieus pes a la partida pus dejos del ventre, e las sieus coyssas sian expandudas, e pausa les sieus brasses dejos les sieus denols, e lia quascus am liament ad aquo convenient.	And then it is fitting that you make the woman sit on a chair that has two chairs; and recline on her back and adjust her feet at the partition below the belly, and her thighs are expanded, and place her arms below her knees, and tie something with a ligament to what is convenient.

Maybe if the other members are numb and the head is turned, then the metrona inserts the left hand; maybe if the mouth of the mother is opened, then insert the hand in the prison of the liver, and seek with that the head, and thrust that with the fingers until the mouth of the mother, and then insert into it one toe, or two toes, and thrust it with those.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas.	And if the mouth of the mother is contracted by apostema because it reaches the one which accedes to the u, then it is necessary that it not be troubled over it; beforehand it is necessary to administer effusion of humid and greasy causes.
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	And administer emplasters; and follow the patient in waters that mollify and humectate.
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	And if the feet are on the high rib, then if it is possible, it should be agitated: and it should be administered what we have said in the old foot.
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	And if that is not possible, then it should be inserted in patches, and it should be extracted.
E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	And it is necessary that you do not leave any underlying cause of the second fever.
E cum tu auras complida tota la tua opperacio, lahoras aministra aquo que havem dit de la curacio en les apostemas cautz les quals accideysso de la mayre.	And when you have completed all your operation, then administer what we have said about the cure of the apostemas caused by the ones which accede to the mother.
E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	And if it accedes to flow of blood, then it is necessary to place them in stipitic waters and administer the other cure.
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	And I have already seen a woman in the belly of which was dead foot, and then on that same focus another pregnant wound, and then the dead foot is the other foot.
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	It happens that for a long time an abscess has been forming in the patient's swollen belly; and it has inflated inward, and begins to take hold of the arm.
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	And you have been called to care for him, and have treated him for a long time, but the wound is not consolidated.
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	Then you should place upon him some plaster of strong attraction, and extract from him a bone, and then you will pass some few days, and extract another bone; and you have been too marvelous, since there are no bones in the belly.
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	And then you should think that they were from the dead foot's bones.
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	Then you should heal the wound, and extract from him many bones, the woman existing in the numerous milk-like dispositions, and already you have seen it in such a manner for a long time, correcting one small arm.
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	And you do not find it strange, but rather that it is science and help to arrive at the artificial hand by which the doctor performs administration of care.
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	About the forms of the instruments that are necessary to extract the foot.
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	Form of vertebrae in which the matrix is opened:
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the form of stretcher on which the books are placed, to which stretcher two vertebrae are joined at the ends of two feet.
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	The emperor ordered this vertebra to be made more subtle than the stretcher, and it was made of ivory or of wood from trees.
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	And it was the width of each wood that two fingers and a margin of each hand that one finger, and the length of each is a palm and a half; and in the middle of two woods there are two adjustments of that same wood which are already fixed, of which the length is a palm and a little more, and the width of each is two fingers, or a little more.
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	And these two additions are inserted into the mouth of the matrix so that it is opened when you revolve the two prescribed vertebrae.
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	Another form similar to that one, but more subtle and more lightweight:
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	It was made of wood from ivory or trees according to the resemblance of forceps.
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	The emperor ordered that on the extremity of him there be two additions thus at times, and the length of those additions is a palm, and the width of each is two fingers.
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	And when you want to open the matrix, then you do seize the woman above the lying feet, pending on opening what is between his thighs.
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	And then you will hold your hand on the instrument thus as you do with forceps, according to the quantity that you want of the aperture of the matrix's mouth, until the meter makes it so that you want.
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	The form of vertebrae which the ancients described:
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	Form of propeller in which the foot is propelled:
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	Form of amputator in which the big head is cut off:
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.
