And it is assembled like a forceps to which the teeth are attached on the extremity, thus at times, and some veiled ones were made long thus as forceps according to this form, thus at times, to which the teeth are attached thus as the teeth of resection in which they are incised and cut off.
Forma de amesidat pauc:	Form of small amputator:
Forma de unci havent una spina:	Form of a hook having a spine:
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	Form of a hook having two spines:
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	Form of forceps to which the teeth of closure are attached, in which the head of the foot is cut off:
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	Form of a spatula having two extremities at which the head is absorbed:
Forma de dos espatums latz:	Form of two wide spatulas:
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	All those instruments are exceptional, and when they are multiplied, the species of that are prepared by the artisans, as it is lighter in their operation and more autonomous from the men for their quantity.
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	And you do not lack those instruments, for it is necessary that they be there, because the necessity of those is not excusable.
De extraccio de la segondina.	About the extraction of the second [or secondary] one.
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the secondary one is retained by the enfantament, then it is necessary that you command the malady to retain its own ale, and then you make that stornudar in condition, and strengthen your hand over its mouth and over its nostrils, and if thus it is deformed, well it is.
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	And afterwards, then you take a cup and perforate in the covering a hole and pause on that herb which opens the mouth of the matrix, thus as calm and rough and aniseed and camomile and Arabic scammony and cassia lignea and santal.
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	All these herbs or some of them are submerged in water in the cup, and pause that over the fire.
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	And then you pause a cane of cane in the mouth of the matrix, and hold it until the vapor comes to the concavity of the matrix.
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	And then you will make that treatment thus as we have said, and the second one will be rapidly forgotten.
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	Perhaps you will perform this cure and it is not useless, then you order the midwife to submerge her left hand in warm oil or in a mixture of other herbs, and then you insert that into the womb and search for it with the second one, and when you have found it, take it out little by little. Perhaps it is annexed to the womb of the mother, then you insert your following hand as we have recommended, and when you have found the second one, extract it little by little so that the mother does not feel vehement attraction.
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	Before you proceed, make sure your right and left hands are facilitated.
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	And then adjust it in the quantity of attraction, so that it will obey and evacuate adherence.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	And if the mother's womb is constricted, we have not recommended the treatment with stirring and medication of the opening with herbs.
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	Perhaps it is not forgotten among all the causes that we have recommended, then beware that you do not fatigue about that in iteration of abstraction, perhaps however it is certain that what is ejected from her to the womb of the woman lies in the space of the female, and then crystallize that with enguent and tetrafarmacon; because that will make it dissolve and be forgotten in a few days.
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	Perhaps when it is purified, it rises to the head, and to the stomach, and that leads to the illness; and then it is certain that they have been administered subtle fumigations and conveniently adapted to that.
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	Perhaps some of the Ancients already knew how to prepare subtle fumigations from narcissus and dried figs.
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	Method of instrument with which the woman is subtly fumigated to prevent the retention of menses and of the second one.
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	It should be made from iron or copper.
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	And the subtle extremity is placed in the womb and the wide extremity is above the focus, and the subtle fumigation is placed above the arms of the focus.
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	And hold that in until it is consumed by that subtle fumigation and then another.
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	Of the treatment for the birth of an unperforated infant.
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	Born infants are like that and their births are not perforated, which have subtle signs and are covered over.
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	Then it is certain that the midwife will perforate with the finger mentioned that sign; and if not, she will perforate with a sharp spatula, and beware that you do not touch the liver.
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	And then stop on that woolen pad in vinegar and oil; and then cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	Perhaps you fear that it is covered over, then pause with a tube for many days, and wait until the infant wants to expel.
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	And then you hasten the covering of the birth for consolidation of plague or of abscess; then it is certain that this consolidation is incised, and then it will be cured with what we have said about the treatment and of the lead.
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	Of the treatment for fistulas that occur below.
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	The fistulas that occur below in the lower part then swell and become thick, those which occur near the birth beforehand or in the space of one part.
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is a fistula or many.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	And when that swelling is old and corroded by the acidic white humidity or subtle putridity, and some vegetations grow from these fistulas, some penetrating.
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	And those penetrating ones are known through what is ejected from them for the exit and for settling; and some veins use the badness of exit, and they are ejected from those worms.
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	And from those fistulas some vegetations grow in the penetrating space into the bladder, and into the meat of the vein; and from those penetrants into the joint of the hip and into the node of the coccyx.
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	And that which is known as a penetrating fistula into the womb and non-penetrating, it is that you put the mentioned finger end in the womb, and then you insert a subtle probe of iron or copper into the fistula when it is not twisted.
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	Perhaps if it is twisted, then insert the subtle probe of lead or horsehair into that until you feel the probe or hair in the mentioned finger.
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you do not feel that at all and it does not proceed from the tube for any cause of ejection or worm or windiness, thus as we have said, then you will know that it is non-penetrating, and then you should resort to treatment.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula is penetrating into the bladder or into the meat of the vein, then the sign of it is the emission of urine from that and prohibition of it from being thus, so that the place in medicine is consolidated.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	Perhaps if it is penetrating into the joint of the hip or into the bone and causing pain in the circuit, then the sign of it is that the probe penetrates here if it is not twisted into the bone, and causing pain in the circuit of the part; and that sometimes there is putridity; and that this medicine is of no value, nor is it consolidated with an ointment.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all those ulcers penetrating not is the total cure, and the cure of those is the trouble and evacuation of foolish doctors above the one who stops them.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	Perhaps in that which does not penetrate and is not ancient, health is iron fence spread according to what you have recommended, and that which has already been and proposed.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And it is that the patient lies between your hands above his back and raises his legs inward towards himself, the thighs being inclined towards his belly, and you insert a probe of lead, or of iron if it is in the ulcerated tumor, until you feel the place where you perceive the probe.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if the patient feels around the neck, then it is necessary that you insert your finger pointed into the neck.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel with your finger the probe already penetrated to discover if it has met, or if you feel between your finger and the siphac or flesh, then you know certainly that it is penetrating; and therefore do not trouble yourself with it, because it is not in it a cure, as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	Perhaps the emperor's physicians claim that it is healthy in some homes to be bitter.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And the medication by which you expect to cure the patient is that you apply subtle cautery according to the size of the ulcer, as it has been described, and you insert the ignited part into the ulcer until it reaches around the neck; and then you iterate this two or three times until you know that all those adjusted ulcerated flesh resembling a bird's plumage are fully cured.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And then you cure that wound by enveloping it in bandages until all those adjusted flesh is fully healed, and then you cure that wound with medicines that engender and consolidate the flesh, and if it is healthy, good; and if not, then it is not healthy at any time for another cure.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the probe goes in, and does not penetrate into the finger which is in the anus, and between that and the probe which is only a space of flesh or of siphac, and sometimes the ulcer is in what is the surface of the codena, then you drain the codena from the beginning of the ulcer, and you see that it is drained with the probe, and it is in the ulcer until the drainage reaches the place where you feel the extremity of the probe, and by the probe it is freed and extracted.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And then you cleanse those ulcerated flesh which resemble a bird's quill and do not remain with any of those ulcers for any cause.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	Perhaps it is necessary to cleanse many times what comes between you and your operation when you touch those flesh, then the thousand times it is good and of the less proud instrument is to cauterize with fire or with acute medicine, because cautery with fire adjusts well two good habits: so it is the adjustment of those adjusted flesh, and the cutting off of the blood's excessive excretion of humors.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And then you cure that wound by enveloping it in bandages or in stitched causes until the place gets strength, and then you cure the plague with medicine that engenders and consolidates hard flesh.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And these medicines are those which stop the putrefaction and excess; when then it is restored, it is already healthy and does not fear relapse.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	Perhaps the ulcer has already penetrated into the groin of the anus and is elongated from the surface of the body, then you insert your finger into the anus and examine it.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And then you feel the probe and between you and it is only a space of siphac or of flesh, and it is ready for penetration, then it is not an operation on him unless according to the way of confidence and of hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	This cause is to be administered in him in one of three ways: either to cauterize it as we have said; or to drain it until you reach the cavity of his body so that it is possible for you to insert the fistula and the proposed cure; and do not process more than one drainage so that you do not irritate the contained bowel, and that you agree upon the patient's consent; and then you cure it with what we have said because the strong sir is healthy; or you elongate the space and wound that you drain until you reach the anus, as we have said, either with a probe or another instrument of acute extremity, and then you cleanse those ulcerated flesh which are in the drainage until one can percuss; and then you strive to make the restoration of all the plague in the drainage, and if the horrid pus is not consolidated, and the ulcer remains open in the part of the anus, and it will be less proud for the patient.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And the ulcers are finished according to this way: it is when you insert the probe into the ulcer, and it is in the width of the anus around the surface of the body with the codena and in the margin of the anus, then you take a perforated extremity probe, which is like a needle prepared to pierce the flesh according to this form.
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and you insert into that ulcer enveloped by five ulcers or around those; and then you insert the probe into the ulcer until you reach the cavity of his body.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	If the penetration is in the margin of the anus because of dentition, then you extract the thread of that trauc thus that you introduce the finger into the anus; and extract the extremity of the thread and adjust both extremities, and strengthen each one, and let it be for a day or two, and when you have inserted the thread in the flesh, strengthen well that entrance so that those fleshes are not inserted between the two extremities of the thread and fall.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And then heal the wound so that it is consolidated and cured.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the orifice of the fistula does not penetrate, then make it penetrate, in whatever way you are prepared, but not so much in the groin, because it is not up to you to do that so that no laceration occurs; and then make that entrance be cured.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of the spatula is such that it is divided into a fistula: the curvature of which is very acute and the other part is not-acute, so that nothing unnecessary occurs, just as sometimes happens.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	About the stitching of hemorrhoids in which a blood flow occurs during the incision of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are treated in two ways, because either they are between the buttocks resembling a carbuncle, or those are like a layer of rough skin.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And those are small and large, and the blood flows from them at times and it is one, and they are many, and they are outside the anus, and on their extremities.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	However, those that are outside the anus are treated according to the method of little humidity, from which flows yellowish water or a little blood continuously, and it is according to the color of the flesh.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the cure of that which is dentition in the anus is that you command the patient to sit down and to exert themselves so that the anus opens up and the hemorrhoids appear to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you take them with your fingers and suspend them in an uncus or hold them with your nail, and then cut those roots with their roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	If the uncuses are not held by them due to their humidity and softening of those, then take them with a rough cloth or a knife or a flannel of wool, and extract them from the fingers, and then cut them and powder over them some warm powders, in order that they be in place of cautery; or cauterize them according to what is written in the chapter on cauterization.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then heal those with another cure until they are cured.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the anus does not obey to excretion, then you clysterize the patient with a clyster in which there is a small amount of mild potion, and wash them with that water that is in the anus and it obeys to excretion more easily when the patient strains themselves.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	If the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then the cause of them is ease, and it is that you take them with your nail, or take them with an uncus, and cut them, and then heal those with what we have said until they are cured.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And he who has made an incision, must administer stitching of them according to this method: take a thread wrapped around and insert it into the needle and then extract the hemorrhoids from the top parts, and make it penetrate with the needle into the root of the other part, and wrap both extremities of the thread around the part below the needle, and thus latitudinally; and strengthen the hemorrhoid in a strong structure, and then cut the thread and extract the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And make it all whole, and let one of those be not bothered, so that the superfluity of the blood flowing from that one.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	And then pause on the anus with a cloth soaked in rose oil or in cerate; and pause that on the anus and command the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be until it scars; and when it falls, heal those with an ointment or another cure until they are healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	On the cure of fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Many ways are used for excision of a wound or for constriction of nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And since they are antiquated and of no value in that medicine, then it is necessary that you root them out with the point of a spatula or with your nail until they are made humid and held back by the scab that forms above, which prohibits their consolidation; and then heal those until they are consolidated.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you remove them with a razor strongly that the first way until much blood flows and they are excoriated; and then heal those until they are cured.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	On the cure of wounds, it is clear.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	You know that wounds, it is clear, and it is not so if you do not notice the redness according to the color of the body resembling a head of nails, and it is made in all the body and mainly in the parts below the feet and fingers, and it ends for those who have pain in their limbs.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And then it is necessary that the doctor should inspect what is in the circuit of the vein, and hold the forked ends or hook, and eradicate the root; and then take care of that.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	If you want, cauterize the gangrenous part that is located in the following chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	More of a true wart appears as a small, rough, rounded fistula on the surface of the body, and many ulcers come in the hands of children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the treatment of it is to extend or insert that, or to stretch it with a file or a pellet inside the box.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you want, cauterize that, as we have said, with fire or acute medicine.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And now the inverted and non-inverted ones are eradicated by the instrument which you direct.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	More often a formica (insect) appears as a small, hairy or fistulous growth on the surface of the body, especially in the groin area, and when it touches that, it is said to be similar to the bite of an ant, and it is made around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the treatment of it is to take a hollow needle of peacock's feather or of vulture's feather, and make it strong, and place that over the formica until it encircles the area of the skin; and then revolve your hand around the needle until you insert what is in the circuit of the formica, and place that in the groin area of the flesh, and eradicate the formica from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you want, make that with a needle of iron or of steel according to this form:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The part beneath the hollow needle should be subtle, dull (not perforated), enveloped so that on the said part the absorption of it is abolished and the revolution of that.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you want, cauterize the formica according to what has been said previously in the chapter on cauterization of atheyl.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	In the shape of instruments that are administered to give crusts.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Some ulcers are treated with crusts of silver or of gold or of iron fondue or molten; and some ulcers are treated with those small and large instruments according to those which are administered, because that which is administered in the cure of small children should be small; and of those whose wounds are fresh or dolorous, the crusts of those should be small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The shape of large and few crusts:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The head of the hollow needle beneath which the bag is tied should be wide according to this manner; and it should be distinguished at the point where the bag is tied, thus at times.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the extremity of the pus beneath, which is inserted into the anus, should be dull (not pointed) like a lion, with subtlety; and on one side of the groove there are two tracks, and on the other side one track, and the width of the track is according to the size of the rays and a large pus is small.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And the bag in which are placed the medicines of bladder of beast or of wool of sheep, and the root of it is a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be perforated by many small tracks, thus as it is revolved; and if the space which is between the tracks is very large.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then insert into those tracks a strong file of crude iron which is of many sharp points, or around those; and adjust to that the bag; and when it is placed in the body, it should be tightened at the head of the crust between two distinct and strong constriction points, and then cauterize on each track: More the quality of cauterizing on that is that you fill the bag with medicine, which should be heated according to the quantity of tolerance of the patient; and beware that it is not too hot nor too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And then the patient should be resupinated on the two Siege, and elevate their legs up and place one cord above which already has holes or a lantern; and then anoint the extremity of the cauterizer with oil or album of Huou or mucilage of fenugrec or of similar things; and then insert that into the anus to facilitate, and then the minister takes the bag and extracts that in two masses and seven times with vehemence until it is evacuated from the intestine all that is in the crust; and then extract the crust and the patient raises their legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces that to evacuate, hold it as much as you can; and if you sleep on that for a whole night, it is more direct in juvenation.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	More if you cauterize that in the illnesses of solution of belly and evacuation of the intestine, then you iterate the cauterizer until it is sanctified.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the anus there are emorrhoids or apostemes of lenient nature, then the crust should be subtle and gentle, among the crusts which children are treated with.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Of the treatment of plagues.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	I have already said in the division of the treatment of plagues what is convenient to the book, and I will say thus the treatment of those with me and with medicines according to the complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore, it is said that wounds are diversified according to whether they are caused by cold humors and according to the location on which they occur.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes by which many wounds are caused are cold humors, so it is also with a treatment of foot pain, or incision of the skin, or cutting of the vein, or percussion with a lancet, or with a needle, or with a scalpel, or similar to those of many causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	Many wounds that are in the parts of the body are also like a wound that falls on the head, or the neck, or the chest, or the stomach, or the liver, and similar to those of the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I recommend the cure of some wounds because it pauses that rational thinking and rule over the other wounds.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with simple head wounds, for the remembrance of the compounded treatments will come to the beginning of the third capital chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, it is said that when simple head wounds occur and there is no fracture, then consider: if it is due to foot pain or similar, and you have already trampled the code so much alone and it is a great wound and fears about that patient having apostema catch, then you should take away and remove the cephalic inflammation as soon as possible, and do not delay; and extract according to the quantity of the virtue of the blood if there is no prohibitive cause for removal, especially if the blood is exhausted from the wound, little by little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And it is the removal of the contrary part of the wounded area; and beware of the patient's relapse and of vicious and coarse habits.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	Many times, if a minor prohibition occurs, then it is diminished by the diet and does not approach to flesh nor to vices.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And pause on the wound, if it occurs with apostema catch, where it infuses in oil rose solute or in wine on which it is stipulated.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	Many times, if it is sure of apostema catch, then pause on the wound, if it is recently with healthy blood and the air has not changed that powder which I recommend to apply little by little.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that, then pause on the excessive ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	Many times, if the wound is large or is due to incision of the skin and similar, and the lips of it are not adjusted for pustules, then adjust them with a suture according to how I recommend the suture of theirs.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	Many times, if the wound is already discovered in the bone and flesh, and it is not retained by it except for a small suspension, then incise that and apply proper cure to the wound with medicines and restore the flesh properly in place of the code, and command the patient to be moderate in vices in which there is grossness: take capsules and form a mixture similar to theirs, until it is compounded.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find putrefaction in the code and it does not adhere to the bone, then you incise all that purulent matter and evacuate it, and apply proper cure to it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	Many times, if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which flows healthy blood that may come out, and it is not abscessed by medicines, then you inquire about the artery, and if you find it not incised, then you incise it with a spatula, or ligate it; and if it is necessary to provoke what we have said does not conflict, then you cauterize until the blood is abscessed.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is light; thus you powder on those with this powder, because consolidated then, so that the air does not change them.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the preparation of the powder is this: take one part of olive oil, two parts of dragon's blood, three parts of non-extinct earth; let it be well-triturated and crushed, and of that, let the wound be filled, and let it be constricted by good constriction until it be on that adhering surface, and let it be coagulated with the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And apply strength to that beneath the pustules and lift it up, and do not dislodge it while it is thus that it does not become apostematous, because it is not eradicated from it by medicine until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And some wounds only require solute cautery, when it is not at your disposal in the present of olive oil and dragon's blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And I do this medical operation on large wounds when it is convenient to pause over them and they are strengthened, and thus recent wounds with their healthy blood, which the air has not altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is in summer time, then it is not intended for the position of this powder, but rather cure them with what we have said, thus you pause on those excessive ointments digesting, or you pause on those pores of the flour of the ordinary bread with water and honey until they get purification; and apply proper cure to them with another cure until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	More often it happens that a broken fracture in bone occurs, and it is small, then you extract what you have handled.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I will teach you the treatment of fractures of the head in that which is coming.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the sores of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	More often the sore happens in the neck, then it is not different in medicine, and between the sore of the head when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	More often the nerve of the neck is cut or artery, then if it is a nerve, it does not engender in the inguinal region but rather evades cure of the one who makes vehement strictures, thus like zinc and gypsum that seems veteran and similar to their quarrel, no other than the nerves and contradicts that.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And it does not stop upon the sore for any total cause of all cold, because the substance of the nerves is cold and their continuation to it is in the brain, which is the pus most high above all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is that which is cured by gentle medicines, thus like the cause washed with warm water, some infused oil in rose-water or non-rose-water, and thus when it is washed with warm water and other small pearls, minorant according to this manner, and gently humid.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	More often the sore is great, then administer a suture, or stitch the lips of it, and then care for that with powders entering until it be healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	More often the sore is deep or happens in the lowest part of the purification, then perforate that in the place most premiered.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	More often in the sore an artery is cut and a flow of blood is consequent, then separate or dry that, or tie that, or cauterize that if necessary to provoke to stop it.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	More often you have cut the vertebrae of the gullet or all, and so saved the veins of the neck, then you adjust the lips of the codena with a suture over the cane of the gullet and do not touch that; afterwards equalize that and return it to its natural figure, and then strengthen that in a decent structure, and leave that for some days; and then care for that with gentle humidness in which there is strictness and excitement until it be healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	More often the sore is in the bone and has made an impression, then pierce that, and then if there are fragments of bones, extract all those that you can from them; and what you have not appareled, leave it until the sore closes itself, and it be separated and the edge of it be alleviated.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the sore is recent then powder over that with the powder which I have recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	More often in the sore a fistula is made, then cure that with water of which the remembrance will come to you properly in the following chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of the sores of the neck or of similar ones that are made between the spine and are made with a span or with a knife or with a lance or with similar ones.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a percussion of a lance or of a knife, and sometimes of its depth, then consider more often if the sore has been venomously infected when the patient is in a bad state; then you will know that the sore is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if it is not deep and the sore is recent in the healthy blood, then you stop in it of the first hour powder, and do not strengthen that so the blood is not retained in the depth of it and returns to the heart and helps the patient, more pause in it with gentle attraction, and dissolve that two times a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the gentle attraction is not present to you, then pause in the orrifici of the sore as much as possible so that it sucks out what is of the humidities; and make that the patient sleeps on the sore so that it runs what is in it adjusted.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	More often if the sore has passed three days or more and does not happen to the patient spasm nor tremor of bad heart nor stricture of wing, and sometimes the other good dispositions of it, then you will know that the sore is saved; and then care for that with warm waters and another cure until it be healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	More often if the healing of it is excessive, and already all time is overcome, then you will know that a fistula has been made; care therefore for that according to the following chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the sore is by incision of a span or of a knife, and is simple on the surface of the foot or of the back, then cure that with water that is preceded by suture, if it is great, or with powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	More often if it has made an impression in the bone, and then of it you cut out pieces, then you twist the sore and take care to extract those pieces, if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	More often if they are not separated, then leave them until the sore closes itself, that the extraction of them is alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of the other sores accidentally happening in the other members, the treatment is the treatment of what we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	From the wounds of the belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition that occurs in the belly is great, or small, or mediocre.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	From the great many worn-out veins of the intestine or nerves of the intestine, because it is a faulty introduction of theirs and the suture of theirs being more violent and more subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And the small disruption is made difficult by another manner, and it seems that the reduction of theirs is more difficult, if you do not take care of their introduction to the right place at once, because it becomes inflamed and is grossly engrossed, making the instrument's entry difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the moderate disruption is better, because in that case it is not difficult to reduce the intestine, just as it is difficult in the two species mentioned beforehand.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And it is known that the suture of the belly is according to four manners, but two sutures are common that are convenient for sutures of the other wounds of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other proper sutures communicate with the other wounds, but however they are more proper in the suture of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to each one an exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore it is said that when the wound is small and some cause of the intestine appears for that, and it is difficult to reduce it, then it is in one of two manners: either by smallness of the disruption as we have said, or when the intestine has been inflamed by the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when it is so, then you should scald that in this way, that you submerge a humid sponge in lukewarm water only, or that you cook in boiling water, and cyperus, and spikenard, and embroilas, until the inflammation of the intestine is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And some worn-out veins make it clear that in which they have stipulated, and it is better than lukewarm water alone for resolving the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see the inflammation is resolved, then you moisten the intestine with water in which there are decoctions of altaea and malvas, because for that reason it alleviates the instrument's entry with little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the instrument's entry is excused by this cure, then it separates the disruption with a small instrument in which you have inserted emollients.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the primary cure is better, when it is properly done so that there is no setback, and there is no occupation to setback again with necessary defeat.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	About the instrument, see its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of it is sharp-pointed, and the other part not-acute, and the extremity subtle, and not with the subtlety of a spatula, but rather it is obtuse a little.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the wound is amplified and is outside the intestine, then it is necessary that its reduction be according to the natural form of it, in its own proper place, if it is possible about that, because better it is.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the disruption is large, and it is in the lower part of the belly, then it is necessary that you make the patient lie on their back, and place their legs higher than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you place their head and feet higher than the other parts below.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the belly, then you place your attention and consideration at all times in this way so that the part where the wound is may be higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus it is necessary that you administer this in great wounds and in moderate wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small wounds, place this that is prepared for you, and make it so that the minister is between your most skilled hands, which hold the disruption totally with their hand and adjust the lips of it, and thus uncover from that to whom it is necessary to suture some cause for another.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suture: one that takes the needle, or counts of needles according to the quantity of the amplitude of the wound; and thus you leave the extremity of the disruption of the ring finger, and stretch the needle once, so that you do not put faith in the two extremities of the code, with two extremities of the ciphac which is below the code of the divided parts, until you make it penetrate from that part; and you have already added two extremities of the code and two extremities of the ciphac, and so four orders are made.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And thus you stretch with double faith in the circuit of the needle, and some worn-out veins of two parts together, and thus add the two lips to the wound for decent addition; and thus leave the thickness of the finger and fix another needle there, and thus tie it with faith as it was tied with the first needle; and do not cease from doing this if it is necessary among the needles until you have completed all the contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And thus the moderate needles are between grosness and subtlety, because the subtle needles move with ease into the flesh; and the large ones are of difficult entry into the code, and therefore it is necessary that they be moderate in subtlety and grosness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	It is not suitable that the needle be fixed in both extremities of the spine, so that the flesh is not deeply incised and the wound does not hinder the consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	They should not be prolonged with suture, so that the wound is not prevented from consolidating.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then insert the extremities of the needles so that they do not loosen the patient from his sleeping bed; and place pillows expanded on the entire affected part, which hold the extremities of the needles; and thus you will know that the wound has already consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And in these species of suture with needles, it is more convenient to use them in small wounds, for you will need only one or two needles around those.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	The second suture is common: and it is that you administer the suture to the four extremities, of the spine and two extremities of the hip, at once, with a needle in which the thread is wrapped in subtlety and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then when the needle has penetrated these four extremities, return the needle from that same part where it started, so that the thread retracts and comes out of the subcutaneous part to the wound, so that the suture is according to the suture of the fabric in which the fabrics are strongly stretched.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And pause between each suture the amount of thickness of the little finger's mending.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And in this suture, wise men are knowledgeable.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And in such a suture, I have often closed the wound which was inflicted on a man in his own belly, which had been wounded by a knife, and it was the disruption of a major wound of about a palm, and it was situated around two palms from the intestine in the middle place, and it was the disruption in the middle of the limb; and then I have often reduced that swelling which the intestine had been outside the wound for 23 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was consolidated in a space of 15 days or around, and I cured him and he is healthy; and then I visited him for many years, and he is converted into his own dispositions.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other doctors had judged that he could not be healed; and by a miracle it was done, for I did not heal him with an ointment, because it was in a place where ointments were not effective nor any medicine, but I placed a compress on the wound for many days and nights, and I washed assiduously with honey water until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	Moreover, I will describe two species of proper suture according to the narration of Pareula.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is that you begin with the suture of the spine, and insert the needle from the front part to the back part.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And thus when the needle penetrates into the spine and in that same place it is rectified according to the straightness and length of the entire body, and there is the extremity of the hip where you have inserted the needle; and make it penetrate into the other extremity from the back part to the front part in the other extremity of the thigh.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And thus when you have made it penetrate, then make it penetrate another time in the same extremity of the thigh from the front part to the back part; and there is the extremity of the hip which is in this side, and make the needle penetrate into the other extremity from the back part to the front part.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make it penetrate to that point your penetration, which you make penetrate into the hip in the extremity of the mirror, which is in the part of him within, so that all that penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then begin with this same method and sew up the extremity which is of the hip on the other side, and extract the needle from the spine that penetrated, and then return it to the spine and fix the extremity of the hip which is on the other side in this same extremity of the mirror; and extract it from the spine which is part of him.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do it one time and another, and do it one time then another time until you sew up all that is before according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this manner of suture is that you sew up the skin with the suture in which you sew up the skins, thus that you sew up the hip one time from the part of the extremity of the spine, and then leave it another time until it is completely healed.
