And I saw the thigh of it and the matters that flowed from it through those orifices for a great body; and already the body of that man was wholly stabilized and the color of it was citrine.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted a probe into one of those orifices and penetrated the probe to the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And you have examined and scrutinized all the openings and thoroughly investigated those that come from all parts of the leg.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	Then you have touched and felt inside one of the openings that enter to reveal a part of the bone, and you have probed that corrupt and rotten place, and it was already decayed and rotten and blackened; and it was already corrupted a part of the leg that had penetrated into the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then you have cleared away what was covering the exposed bone and prepared it.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And you have cut away that which was not of the bone but rather that corruption which you had uncovered and cleared away, and you have already destroyed it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then you halted the restoration of the wound with consolidative medicine for a long time, but it was not consolidated.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then you have iterated and uncovered the bone again according to the primary discovery, and you found continued corruption in the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And cleared away what seemed to come from that corruption, and then you have tried to make a perforation to cure it and restore it, but it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then you discovered it again on the other side and didn't cease to incise the small bone little by little particularly and perforate for its restoration, but it was not restored until you incised around a palm of it, and that extracted marrow from it, and then you restored it with medicines, and it was consolidated gradually and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And it is not necessary to repeat the operation on it and to section it except for the disposal of its fluid and for the scarcity of its tolerance and fear of its death, because it will hasten in all hours to overflow with bad evacuation synchronously.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And so it is healed entirely, and there is nothing in the place of hard flesh; and it is well done the disposal of it in its own body and returned its strength to it; and it is converted into its own dispositions and does not oppose ambulation nor harm in any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if it is an eminent bone in the place of the body already traversed, then it is necessary that you section it according to this manner: and it is that you take a ligament and strengthen that in the extremity of that eminent bone, and command it to extend itself into its own; and pause that ligament of wool which is thicker than the primary ligament; and then tie it over the flesh that is below the bone, and extend the extremity of it so that you attract the flesh to the parts below, and you discover the flesh over the place where you want to saw so that the saw does not hurt the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And pause or place a table below the bone decently, because when you do that it is not prohibited to saw without sectioning the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And it is necessary that the sawing be on the corrupted place little by little, because if it is in the cavity of the corrupted bone and does not appear in its appearance to the sense, and forces the sawing from the other side.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted and not eminent, before it is one continuous part with the other, and the corruption is in the middle place or in a part of it, then you discover the flesh of all parts entirely; and then pause below, and then saw that from the primary part where the corruption is until the sawing of the other part is continued.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And the sawing is according to the place of the corruption a little, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, incise that corrupted joint, and saw the bone where it is continued from the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in its reason but rather in its ingenuity.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the thickness of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however, it is necessary that you inquire into the corruption in whatever manner appears to you, and that you grasp that, and modify that according to each disposition which is possible for you, and in case something ingenious can be rectified for you, when it does not do contrary to your vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And you know that the incisions and saws to incise these bones are very subtle according to the situation of the bones, and their preparation, and their thickness, and their subtlety and greatness and smallness, and their hardness and their rarity; so it is necessary that you prepare a total species of operation and convenient instrument for that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And you know that this operation means to you about the species of instrument which you need; when you have great study and long experience with knowledge of the manners of this art, and testimony of manners of illnesses, because then you had them for your metrics, which is convenient to all maladies.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And you have formed in the end of this chapter the number of instruments which you will pause with, as simples as those which proceed to your prohibition, which you experimented on the others.
Forma de serra:	Form of sawing:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another sawing:
Forma de autra serra:	Another type of serration:
Forma de autra serra gran:	A larger form of another serration:
Forma de ray:	Form of a stripe:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	The head of this stripe is according to the form of the head of a star-shaped claw, and its points are according to the form of the points of a steely instrument.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not suitable unless you confound those heads with the joints when they are corrupted, or it is a large wide opening.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Form of a larger razor among others:
Forma de razori menor:	Form of a smaller razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Form of a broad razor:
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Form of another decently made serration: it is made with an arched curve and the sharpness of its iron, and the member of its handle is decently made in a descending manner.
Forma de lu:	Form of it:
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Form of a razor in which there is a concavity:

Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Form of another smaller incisor:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Form of another incisor; this resembles a stripe, and the extremity of it is like a saw, and it is exhibited in many places in the ratio of the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Form of a stripe that is suitable for a ratio of those that are perforated by the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its extremity is triangular and has a sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of iron from India, and similarly it covers all the causes that we have mentioned about razors, incisors, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	About incision extremities and the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities are weakened either by an intrinsic cause or by an extrinsic cause, or as you have medicated that corruption with the cure of those medicines and the cure does not concur, or sometimes the corruption worsens and the member which is not perceived by any cause, then it is necessary to incise that member within that honor, so that the evil may escape through the mouth of the corruption, because the malady would flee from death or from great damage to the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that one to which it happens, is that the member becomes black within until it is understood that fire has already burned, or it weakens next to the blackness until the weakness reaches that member which is his and takes all the body; and thus you should make an incision of that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if it is a cause of corruption from venomous blows, such as those of the sea scorpion or of the viper or of the rhutel and of similar things.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or blow is in the extremity of the finger, then you incise the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it does not spread to the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if it reaches the hand, then you incise that from the root of the finger, and do not give space to the corruption until it takes hold in the finger of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you surround that, then incise the arm up to the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption passes beyond and sometimes surrounds the elbow, then in that case it is the death of the patient; and to administer another cause in cure is to quantity the virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, it happens to the foot when corruption surrounds the toe of the foot, then you incise that up to one of the nails.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold in the skin of the foot, then you incise the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	Moreover, if it reaches into the ankle, then you incise the leg up to the joint of the ankle.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread over the ankle, then in that case it is not possible to cure it except by dismissing (it) and leaving the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the manner of incising the member or of sawing it is that you strengthen the ligament in the part below where you want to incise, and strengthen another ligament over the area; and extend the minister one ligament to the parts below, and extend the minister another ligament above; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments, even spacing them apart until all the flesh is discovered; and then it is incised or sawed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary to place a bandage on all parts so that it does not touch the area, and that the patient's lesion is adjusted and the abscess is cauterized with caution.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	Moreover, if there is flux of blood when it works, then you cauterize the touched area carefully, or place above it some powders that restrain the blood; and then return to your medication until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the injured member with a ligament at a convenient time, and cure it until it is healthy.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you that which happens to a man in his sick foot, this meets with an accident which you and I have recommended, which is to burn the blackness in the sick foot with adjustment that was assembled for combustion of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	That corruption occurs primarily in the dry season when the whole foot tends to be affected.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepares himself to receive the treatment with anxiety, going to the member with vehemence of his, which attracts more pain and distress of his, and he incidentally puts his foot into the joint, and it becomes healthy.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	A long time ago, that corruption occurred in the hand of the mother indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it came to me, and I thoroughly performed the removal of that superfluity on the hand of the medicines, with the purification of his body; and not being receptive to the superfluity, it began to go into the other joint until it began in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And the patient asked me to inject his hand, and I did not want to do so, fearing the repercussions of that superfluity, and more than anything I feared the injection of the dead hand, because the virtue of the malady was above suspicion.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he despaired of me, he returned to his land and it happened to me that the man prepared and injected his entire hand, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this narration except to be an aid concerning that which is said about this disease, and that it may be significant for which it is signified and according to which it is worked.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	About the treatment of joints and the quality of cleansing with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When abscesses occur in certain carnal members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it forms a collection of pus, and then it bursts and perforates, and it is evacuated from him, and one clears the area where it was like a vase, and the cord that is above him like a subtle drapery, and no posterior corruption is generated, and it does not impress on the bone or nerve or ligament, it is called a sinus, and it is not named fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space is prolonged until the corruption begins in some member, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment of it is that one injects the entire cord thus as it is revolved, and mainly when it is subtle and made like a drapery, and they fix it so that it does not adhere to the area for its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	However, if you fear that the cord will adhere and that corruption will not have been achieved by posterior consequence, and on the cord has passed away from the face, then you treat that member with aclyster.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that you consider the sinus, and then if it is large, and the arm that you have is of fetid odor, then youclysterize that member with Egyptian medicine which is of oil and vinegar and zinc, and receiving equal parts, and they are adjusted in a vase, and they are cooked over the fire until the medicine is made red and penetrates to the specific melancholy.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take from him what is necessary and dissolves the member in water and honey; and clysterize that member into the sinus, and strengthen its orifice, and leave the medicine in it for a quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then extract that member with precision; and do so for many days until the sinus is purified and the putridity is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And some vegetables are clysterized with water of cinders, when you do not have this medicine present; and it is that you take the ash of vitriol, and mix it with the water; and then collect that and clysterize that member into it until you confirm that the sinus is then cleared.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the disease has no tolerance for the Egyptian medicine or the water of ash, then clysterize that member with water and honey mixed with zinc trissat, and clysterize that member with wine and honey mixed, because the property of honey is that it purifies and cleans, and the wine makes adhere to the sinus, and mainly when in the wine there has been an excess of sweetness and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do this with some vegetables and you confirm that the sinus is already cleared, then clysterize that member with water that makes the flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And it is that you take from the Greek dyaphinicon and dissolve that member in oil of rose and wine stipid; or that you clysterize that member with some medicines and other Greek things that have the properties which I have already written about in the treatise on Greek things.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the sinus is straitened in which the cannula of the clyster cannot be received, then you amplify that member by ferrum little by little, and pause in the warm water enveloped in Egyptian medicine or in basilicon medicine until it is amplified.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the orifice is ample, then you join the lips of that member by suture and leave a quantity of it in which the clyster is added.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice of that which flows to the arm is elevated to the superior parts, then dry it in the pus below the place where it is in the arm, so that the arm may flow into it, because when the arm is constricted at the entrance of the sinus, the flesh will be engendered in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to extract the sinus into the outer environment of the bone, then perforate in preparation for the limb, so that the leg can be treated according to what appears and what does not remain in the retained cause of the arm.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take consolidative medicines that are placed on the convenient sinus, suitable for what you want to extract from the liquid.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada. De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	About the treatment of ague fever.

De extraccio de sagetas.	About the extraction of arrowheads.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas. Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	Perhaps it is retained in the bone, then you will twist the lame according to counter-pressure until the sagitta penetrates into the bone, and amplify its measurements, and then extract that.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And so, you will lie down for some days, and then return to that until you are cured.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the foundation of the sagitta is in that, then you will impel that into the bone.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	Perhaps the foundation has fallen and you want to administer impulse, then you will introduce that into it, if it is dull, stir with caution so that it enters the concavity of the bone in the cavity of the sagitta and then impel that into the bone.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	Perhaps the sagitta is concave, then you will impel that into the bone with strong stirring entering into it, because the sagitta is alleviated by that.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the sagitta is intoxicated, then you will hollow out all the flesh in which it is true, if it is possible for you, and then cure that with what is convenient.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the sagitta falls in the foot, or in the belly, or in the bladder, or in the rib, and it is near so that you touch that with the tent, and it is possible for you to section about that, then section about that and beware of incision of vein or nerve, and extract that, and then heal the wound if it is indigent, and cure that until it is healthy.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	The form of forceps are those which are adapted to attract the sagittae:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Thus the extremities of theirs are like the beak of a bird which are made sharp when they take hold of the sagitta so that it does not escape.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And of those are made many special types, large, small, and medium-sized, according to the quantity of the greatness of the sagitta and of the small weakness, and of the amplitude of the wound, and of the constriction of it.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	The form of the impelling caution with this concave extremity is thus like the beak of a bird so that it alleviates the intrusion of the sagitta into the bone, and impulsates that dullness.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	The form of the impelling instrument with a dull extremity:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	thus like a radius so that it alleviates the intrusion of it into the concave sagitta and is impelled into that.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On the flebotomy of the veins.

E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some vegetables are administered full of warm water treatment in the bad humors of gout.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And that is why the ventosa should be full and should be bigger, so it is warm water alone or water in which suitable herbs are cooked for that convenience.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of ventosa administered at the fire: let the amplitude of the orrifici be two fingers, according to how we have formed it; and the quantity of the preon should be the width of a palm; and let it be in the fat of it, in the place that is in the circle, the width of it, the hole should be small according to the quantity that enters into it through a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of iron rod or citrus, with thick margins, lion, hinges and ties so that the member does not leave its position on it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And let it be in the middle of the iron or copper crossbeam, where a candle is paused at the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And already this ventosa is greater than the one we have recommended; and the lesser pause of that according to the bad humors and the state of the one who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the ventoses of the old men are weakened, so others than the ventoses of the young and of thick corpulent bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of pausing this ventosa at the fire over the member is that it extends the meca at the fire decently within a pause of a candle of wax, and pauses it on the middle of the crossbeam in the middle place of the ventosa, so that the fire is kindled around the partition below, lest the body of the patient be burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it is paused on the member of the patient, and the finger is on the hole that we have said, until when we hold the ventoses and do not indicate that they open the finger and that the vapor escapes over that hole, then the ventosa will be almost dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And they ignite the meca according to its manner, and then they indicate that they are freed from that.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	Maybe in ventosa that is administered in the bad humor of flatulence, with water, in which there is no crossbeam nor hole, and it is not administered unless it is full of water, and it is paused on the member only warmly.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its form: And this ventosa, the more it is big, the better it is, because it can receive a great quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter 148.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Blood-lettings are not administered on many members unless on the members in which it is not possible to position ventoses, due to their smallness, thus as the foot and gum and similar to them; or on a member denuded of flesh, thus as the finger and nose and those similar.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that have been found to be blood-lettings that are in the waters of muddy worldly affairs.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then they are laid down during the day and night in muddy water until they are famished, and that no cause remains in the belly of those; and then the body is evacuated at the beginning with flebotomy and ventoses; and then the member of the patient is cooled until it becomes red-hot; and then they are paused on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are filled and case.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suck from the place where the wind comes out, it is better for juvenation.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And otherwise, then wash the place with warm water and add a lot of water; and it should be frequently washed and squeezed out.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body is prolonged by the flow of blood vessels, and it is resolved, then you soak a cloth in cold water, and pause that on top until the resolution is absorbed.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is multiplied, then powder with triturated vitriol, or gall and similar things to their stippling causes, until the blood is dried; or place on the area the crushed heads of roasted faba beans, and they will dry until the faba beans adhere to the area, and the blood is dried.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And be careful, if it is necessary, iteration of blood vessels, when it is possible to move them around.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the blood vessels are prohibited from suspension, then frequently wash the place with recent blood or stick a needle in the areas until it gets blood; and then pause, for they will feel some blood as soon as they are touched.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want to calm them down, powder with a little of triturated aloe, or salt, or cinnamon, and it will soon be so.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is many very necessary things in the art of medicine; and it is restoration of fracture and accidental dislocation in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, know that many foolish doctors and vulgar people, who for a long time did not regard the books of the Ancients nor read a letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it is done that this manner of the sciences in our land is private; and I have not forgotten anything from everything at all times; and I have not abandoned what came after, but only through long study of the books of the Ancients and reflection on their understanding, until I extracted the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I added experience and study throughout the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that contains my science and about which I have passed my experience; because I have abbreviated it for you others and freed it from the occupation of prolixity; and I have abbreviated it at the end of abbreviation; and I have shown it at the end of declaration; and I have formed it in many forms of the instruments that are administered in it, as is done by addition of declaration, thus as I did in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections from being fractures of bones, from which the necessary premises are, before we begin the remembrance of broken members and diverse things, each one by one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	I will therefore set out in the prohemium of this chapter the summaries of the sermon; and the chapters to the understanding of those whose beginning is forced by the craftsmen and stationed on the truth of them; so it is you and those who are prompt that they may know or learn this noble art better than you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And then I say that when accidents occur, such as fracture or dislocation or twisting or breaking, then it is fitting that you begin with flebotomy or alleviating that, or at least sometimes, if no cause prohibits, thus as debilitation of virtue, or it is the one to which accidents happen frequently, or in decrepitude, or it is a time of vehement heat, or of vehement cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then I am content with a diet of fresh herbs and of lean meats and of game birds; and I prohibit gross meats and filling up on diets and all diets that fill the veins with blood, until you are secure from apostemic caution, and if you do not fear effusion of matter to the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their first regimen, in which they were accustomed to customary corridor.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And then since the broken bone begins to be restored, then it is fitting that the patient should be nourished with nutritious diets of much and gross food in which there is viscosity, thus as their diets made from wheat flour cooked in water, and rice, and caps, and feet, and stomachs of cows, and ewes, and fresh peas, and gross and similar things to them, and at this regimen it is done a coagulation of fracture by means of ligament and marrow.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And you know that the broken bones, when they are in the old people who are in the first weakness and in the decrepit, it is not possible that they can be continued and consolidated according to their nature through the desiccation of their members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature all the time through the desiccation of those members, and they continue and consolidate those that are of theirs until the end of old age, thus as the bones of small children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	More, imperial nature adjusts and connects above the broken bone of all parties any similar cause to glue in which it is gross that adheres and strengthens until they are sometimes conglutinated and sometimes released, until they come to the end of fortitude and firmness, thus as a focus at the beginning, until no cause prohibits it from its own works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	Because of this cause it is necessary to pause the veins of the patient, veins in which gravity and viscosity and thickness have accumulated, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many varieties of fracture according to the variety of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And we know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the variety of the limbs, because a fracture of the bone of the leg is different from a fracture of the bone of the head; and a fracture of the bone of the foot is different from a fracture of the bone of the back; and similarly all other limbs are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I will come to a remembrance of each species of fracture, explained in its own distinct chapter separate from the others.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many varieties of fracture in the same bone.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the species of fracture of the bone are diversified in their meteyssas; because there is made an arcuated fracture other than that which occurs in the stars; and some veiled ones are made a fracture according to the length of the bone: and so the fractures of the sagittal and stellar and proceeding and not-proceeding, as it is made in the pain when it is prepared to be written, and it is a fracture with plague and disruption in the head, and it is a fracture with small fissure.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And to each species there is generated or tormented proper in restoration of it according to what will come to remembrance of it distinctly in its own places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Many signs of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And because of this it is known as a fracture of the bone: it is a twisting of it, and of that prominence and appearance of it to the sentiment, and so of it when it comprehends with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And then when it is not in the place of apparent twisting or it does not feel deviated from its usual touch when you touch the bone with agitation and the patient does not experience great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that it is a twisting or small fissure, therefore do not cover that you manipulate it with your hand and compress everything; pause over it from the medicines of which I have remembrance at that moment which convenes to the place; and then it will be straight for subtle structure.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And we know that the place where it is arcuated and not divided into two or other than that which does not occur in the sagittal, as it is remembered by all part of its comparison, then it covers that you begin from your hour to rectification of it before it occurs an apostemic cautery.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it occurs an apostemic cautery, then it will leave that for some days within which the aposteme ceases; and then it will be wrapped according to whichever manner you can of elevation and of generation.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And we know that restoration of it and reduction of it is less burdensome than that of the bone in which they occur sagittally.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then it will strengthen according to what will come to remembrance of it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if in the bone there are sagittals, then it is necessary to extend this broken member into two parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two cords or with one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And it is your position in which you pause the member in its natural figure, while the extended parts of the broken member, then you will perform that you make them return to their positions and according to whichever manner you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And beware according to your force that you do not operate on the patient for your operation of their limb or lesion; and perform according to your own power that you apply one bone to another as a companion according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it covers that at that hour you will profitably touch with your hand then, and if sometimes here is some diverse cause, rectify it and wrap it according to the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid vehement extension and compression, as if many foolish doctors make veiled ones that make them occur apostemic cautery for their operation, or make them occur in contraction of the member, as we have seen this for the operation of their veiled ones.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then you will connect, then you will equate and decently operate and structure of that member, and rest and tranquility; you will admonish the patient about this and make them avoid that in the hour of their vigils and of their sleep, and they will see their revolution and agitation, and they will have their ejection, and they will have all their movements in total virtue; and beware that the position of the member is a position in which pain is assured, which cause is because when one feels in the disposition of the position of the member or lesion; then it covers that you will permute that to another disposition of that in which there is no pain; and look at that which the position of it is direct and wrapped, so that the member does not twist when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the structure of the tranquil member is that which I recommend; because we know that broken members are diversified in their smallness and greatness and in the form of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small such as the arm and the finger and the foce and similarly to those, then it covers that the envelopment should be of very subtle wrapping.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	Those who have thick ankles like a cushion or the chest, cover that in which there is a hard and lasting wrapping, because the binding connects the large member and strengthens all parts equally, so that in it there is no spot.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin, make your evacuation of equity, place a suitable bandage on that, over the area of that fracture with three or four wrappings according to whether the member is more meek; and strengthen your hand a little on the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then see if you can apply it to the affected part above the area of the fracture, and strengthen more than you don't force your structure on which you have strengthened the area of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then extend your wrapping around the area of the fracture a little, and soften the structure little by little, until you take hold of the area in a great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap it around the other way over the area of the wrapping, and then see if the wrappings are on the affected part below the fracture; and be your operation in the structure of the wrapping and in softening according to what we have said in the first wrapping above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the layers of wrapping to stop the Leon's bandage or cloth on which the twisting of the fracture is engaged, if there is twisting; and otherwise, do not pause in it for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause over the other bandage, and engage on these wrappings decently and fairly, if in the area there is no inflammation or aposteme to be cautious, and then pause over the one that settles the aposteme and removes the inflammation; and let it be for some days; and then strengthen over the same wrappings.

Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.
