And if you want, place on that moist and scaled area of the cow's skin in a wrapping and stretch over it; and do this several times, because it is moist and reduces its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the cure of dislocation of the shoulder, which is of the joint that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The shoulder of the hand sometimes becomes dislocated, and the reduction of its dislocation is easier, and conversely it is with other joints, but especially because velocity is needed in the reduction of it at the hour in which it is dislocated, lest the place become critical or something happens to the critical point.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of its dislocation is that you place the joint of the hand of the patient on a table and the minister extends his hand, and the doctor places his hand or palm over the vicinity of the joint, and wraps it until it returns to its proper place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	Moreover, it is necessary to consider if the palm has been placed at the belly of the hand, then the patient places the back of his hand on a table for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is preceding from the back of the hand, then the position of the hand of that one should be precisely over the table, so that the doctor's hand falls upon that vicinity of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	Therefore, if it returns soon, it is good; and if not, then strengthen that part with an ointment, and let it be there; and do not touch it, because if not, you will not feel nor put weight on the reduction of pus that passes to the days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	Maybe the Roman emperor is according to his tortuousness; and do not notice in the patient any cause, but rather that the hand is mollified and cannot strengthen any cause; then you know that the nerves are weakened or shrunk, and then it is not generated in him unless it is strengthened with a pointed cautery for the improvement of his case and to confer strength on his conferring cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when the sickness is returned, then stop over the ointment which we have recommended, and let it be there and strengthened for five days; and then it will be dissolved and let it be there, and the patient's hand will be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	Maybe if the movement of it is stopped and stuck in some gravity, then apply that with warm water and friction on certain veins, until it is alleviated.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the cure of dislocation of the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some veins are dislocated from the fingers to the entire joint.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when a finger is dislocated from those at the palm or belly of the hand, then hold the finger and push back the dislocation with the tied poultices, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the finger, and suspend it from the part where it is dislocated, and let it be there for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend it and extend it until it is straightened in that seventh day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is night, lay it according to that narration, and do not cease to dissolve it in the day and exercise its movement, and lay it at night; and do this for some days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do similarly to this, if it is dislocated at the belly of the hand, and lay it at that joint and do the first operation on the poultice, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do this when it is dislocated in other joints.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the cure of dislocation of the vertebrae of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When it happens to one of the vertebrae of the back or neck, a complete dislocation, and so many vertebrae are moved from their places, then there is no cure, because death follows the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And it is sign of this that the evacuation of the patient is beyond their will, and cannot retain it; and many veins are mollified in some members of his or two legs of his or two arms of his, or one of those; or a vertebra is moved from its place, because many veins are moved and many veins are made to make the movement of those in four joints.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Then that has already been moved to the back parts and is called gelbozitation.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	Maybe the cure of it is that then you consider if the gelbozitation happens from weakness, because then there is no cure nor healing of all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	Maybe in that which is seen by chance or by percussion or similarly to those, the Ancients already said the ways of cure are verbose, from which the most returns with profit; maybe you have already heard and abbreviated from that which I have little excuse for the trope of his, for my proximity to the intention of my exposition, in which I have explained and formed diverse instruments of that which I will show and expound.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in gelbozitation which happens from the front to the foot, there is no generation nor healing of that; and similarly in that which is done at two sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those, none are cured except for the one that happens in the back properly, as I have recommended.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the patient should be extended on their face above a soft pillow, and be extended below his instrument as much as possible so that the foot of his is not hindered.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight stick should be placed, fixed in the ground at the extremity of the pillow around his head, and another stick in the air above his feet at the other extremity of the pillow.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the servant should hold the stick, and not be fixed in a pit; and another servant should hold the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then envelop above the head of the patient and below the small linen wraps firmly; and extend the extremity of the wrap to the stick which is at the head of his, and lay it on him; and then strengthen the other wrapping over his hips with his denials, and around his legs; and then adjust all the wrappings and lay them on the other stick which is at his feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then the servant should carefully extend the wrapping to the part of the stick, and do not move the two sticks and the wrappings from their fixed places in which they are fastened, maybe the emperor does not fix them thus as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	The doctor stops his hands on the spinal column for strength until it returns, or stops on that one table, and then adjusts on the table both feet until they return.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	Perhaps if it does not return in this way, then take a table on which the width or length is in the air of three handbreadths, and hollow out the side of the table where we have said the patient's thigh should enter into the extremity of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then stop the flat part of the table on the spine, and the doctor stops both feet on the other extremity, and stretches it until the spine is straightened and returns to its own place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, take the one that is turned around with your hand; and it is that you place on the ground the head of the patient's thigh at the back of two feet, the length of which should be an arm's length, and the head of it at the back of two feet just the same; and let the length between each foot be a palm, and already it is made in each foot through which the course turns, and each one is firmly fixed on the ground so that it does not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let there be a fixed foot in which the course turns, and let it be turned around in the two tracks of the two feet.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And on the extremity of it there is a track in which the foot is formed, the length of which is a palm and a half that is turned around; and on the two other feet it is similar to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then stretch the ligaments that have been stretched on the chest of the patient in the course which is from the head of it, and the ligaments that have been stretched on its thighs in the turn which is from its feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then there is a turn and stays a minister who twists the turn with his hand, and the doctor adjusts the spine according to what we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And then since the spine is returned, and the place is adjusted, then you should apply a plaster of egg white on the album of skin, and then stop; and then stop over the plaster like a table with a width of three fingers or around that, and its length being the quantity that takes the place of the gibosity, and on the part of the spine itself.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then it is relaxed in the ligament which we have said, and use the patient's subtle nourishment until he is healthy.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there remains some impediment in the place at the end of the healing, then you should administer medicines that mollify and soften with an administration on the table for a long time, which we have recommended; and already it is administered in that place a laminate of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And some evil accidents occur in the back of the spine of the two, and it is judged for that dislocation; and it is that bone which already warned you so that you do not think to make a promise to him with this medicine, because strong fear will make you consent to death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 21.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the cure of a dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You know that the joint of the ankle and the joint of the muscle do not deviate unless there is a dislocation only, and it does not occur to those which occur to other joints with small movement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the ankle is dislocated in four ways, because it is dislocated to the inside parts, or to the front parts, or to the inner parts, or to the back parts.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And mostly it is dislocated to the inside parts, and rarely to the inner parts or to the back parts.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of dislocation of it to the inside parts is that, when you adjust the healthy leg of the patient with the diseased leg, it is then longer and the denudation is more prominent than the healthy one, and the patient cannot bend their foot from the ankle, and it is the place where the ligament becomes apostematized by an apostema-causing cautery, so that the head of the thigh has already arrived here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that one to which dislocation occurs to the front parts is that the accidents of it are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of that one to which dislocation occurs to the inner parts is that it expands the foot according to its own complement, but meanwhile it does not bend because of the pain that is in the denudation, and if it is perforated to go out and cannot walk on those inner parts; and its urine is retained and its ligament is apostematized, and its walking is on the ankle.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of that one to which dislocation occurs to the back parts is that it does not expand the denudation, nor can it bend that denudation which bends the ligament, and its leg is shorter than the other, and the ligament is mollified, and the head of the thigh is in that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	Perhaps the reduction of the species of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it has already been antiquated with what you have administered to him, and you should reduce it according to its own disposition, then it is not in that complete cure; and therefore you do not think to make a promise about that.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	In that case where the dislocation is recent, and it is one of the four species of dislocation, then you should strive to return the joint to its proper place and extend it to the posterior and anterior parts, and move it neither to the right nor left, because strong leverage returns it and does not require another kind of cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this manner, then you should prepare a strong minister and extend the leg from the posterior part, or hold their hands, or bind what is tied above the knee; and another minister extends the hand of that one on the other side so that they hold the little fingers of theirs; and you strengthen a ligament over the joint of the thigh, and hold another minister to straighten the extremity of the ligament.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And it is an extension of it or from the posterior part to the angle of the shoulder blade, or from the posterior part to the back, or from behind to the back of the spine.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And it is an extension of all these in one way, so that the patient is elevated on their back with their legs on the ground and remains hanging.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this species of extension is common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And therefore if the dislocation returns to what we have said, it will be good; and if not, then it is necessary for all species that require their own cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of its own, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is in the posterior parts, you should resupinate the patient on their back with their legs raised; and then pause the ligaments over the joint of the thigh in that place where the head of the thigh and the place below the shoulder blade meet; and then extend the ligament from above the angle of the shoulder blade to the further posterior part of the spine.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another strong minister takes hold of their arms, and embracing the large joint of the patient's thigh, extends to the anterior parts for vigorous extension, because that returns it to its proper place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is of lighter cure, in which this member is reduced more easily than the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it is excused above you and does not obey the entrance to this species of cure at all, then you should bind the two feet of the patient together with a strong ligature, lightly, over both ankles and both toes.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And it is the length of each one by the quantity of four fingers, and the patient's leg is extended more than the other by a quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then the patient is suspended over the top of a pole, and that he is in a balance; and it is the length of it from the ground by the quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then command a strong youth to move the head of the thigh, and it is suspended with the patient another youth, and the other youth moves the thigh with strong and empiric force, because the joint returns to its proper place with velocity.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the proper reduction, when it is dislocated to the anterior part, you should make the patient sit on a stool according to what we have recommended in the preceding chapter; and strengthen the ligament over the patient's own leg properly and over their feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And then two poles are placed, one at their feet, and the other at the head; and then two adjusted poles are fixed on the middle of the peg, upon which drips humid sponges are wrapped, so that the patient is not damaged by the pole being between their thighs, so that the extension to the posterior parts is not attracted.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And then each minister extends to their part, and the doctor places his hand on the patient's hand to guide the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if it obeys to reverberation, it will be good greatly; and if not, pause over that diligently and thus as we have said in the preceding chapter for that engagement.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But you should make the patient sit on their back quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in the anterior parts, then you should make the leg be extended lightly, and it is according to this method of narration about the peg; and the doctor places the palm of their right hand on the patient's shoulder blade, and then cuts off that with the other hand, and in that cutting-off pauses the extension to the posterior parts at the back of the spine.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is in the posterior parts, then you should not make the patient be extended to the posterior parts, and it is elevated from the ground; having paused because of hard cause, thus as you should examine if their ankle is dislocated to the anterior parts, according to what we have said about the examination of it on two anchors; and it is over their face and the ligaments are extended, according to what we have said, there is no error.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And you should administer compression on the table over the place where the joint is.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore, when the reduction is completed according to what you should do — and the sign of the reduction of it is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend both legs of the patient, and when you see those joints and the patient's leg is strengthened and expands those excuses, then you know that the member has returned according to what you should do — and then you adjust both thighs and pause in a bandage and strengthen with a strip so that the ankle is not weakened in any of the parts; and adhere the patient to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then release the ligament and the paste, and compare one leg to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see those signs in the vestment, then you know that the dislocation is already fixed, and therefore leave the patient alone afterwards.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see some cause of softening, then you return and apply a plaster to that, and stretch it according to your primary structure, and leave it like that for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then release that, and make it wait in ambulation over some crutches for some days, until it is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the cure of dislocation of the shoulder.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The shoulder is dislocated in three ways, because it is dislocated forward, and backward, and downward more than upward; and it is not dislocated inward.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation of it is that you command the patient to bend their leg towards the thigh; then you know that the shoulder is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all its ways is to make the patient straighten up, and if they can extend their leg, then put it on that; attach the two hands to the face of it, and place their foot between the two hands; and then make them attach the shoulder to their palms, and hold those between the two hands placed on the shoulder with strength, and another minister extends their foot until the shoulder returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of reduction of it is that their leg adheres to the thigh in a lifted and labor-free way.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then apply a plaster to that and make them attach the leg to the thigh, and then bind those together with a bandage for three days or four, and then release it.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not allow the patient to walk about for some days, until they are healthy and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if the reduction of it to you is excused, then administer strong extension on the ligaments of those in the cure of the preceding narrative's wound.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the cure of dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle sometimes is removed by small movement, and sometimes it is dislocated according to completeness, and the dislocation of it is made either backward or forward.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of the dislocation of it is that the ankle becomes swollen proceeding to the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the cure of the movement of it is by gentle reduction, and it is that it should be extended with facilitation on the hands and be bent until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the cure of it when it is dislocated completely, you should make the patient straighten up, and hold that with a strong and valiant minister from behind the two hands on the middle place of it.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you put your right hand straight on the foot above the ankle, and your left hand below the foot at the place of the heel.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then you pull the foot with your right hand, and then with your left hand for two movements, and then extend with your left hand; and you will find the foot of the leg in its proper place.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do that twice according to what we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then you will find the foot of the leg in its proper place at the third movement, and you are at the heel.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore, if it returns in one movement or in two according to this method, and if the foot is bent, it is good; and if not, then repeat the operation, because it will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you are prohibited from reducing it in the way that we have recommended, then make the patient sit on their two feet on the ground, and stretch a strap firmly on the ground, and place it between the thighs of it, and you have already wrapped around it with a cloth so that the patient does not move.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And then the minister of it holds its thighs, and another minister extends the foot with their hands or with a ligament that lies on the top of the foot; and then extend each minister against the extension of the other side, and the strap is extended between the thighs of the patient holding it, so that the body of it is not pulled towards the lower parts beyond its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And then the doctor reduces the dislocation with their hands, and another minister holds the healthy thigh below, so that the dislocation returns to its facility.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And so when the dislocation returns and it is declared to you the health of the reduction of it, then pause and apply a plaster strongly, and bind the foot with a ligament to the leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And be careful that you do not touch or guard the nerves which are behind the ankle, so that the ligament on it is not violent and holds it strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then leave it like that for two days or three; and if the ligament is softened, extend it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And remove that from the third day or on the fourth, and forbid the patient from strenuous activity for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	Perhaps it is forgotten to anaesthetize that space, it is not safe that the dislocation is not on top of it dissolved and corrupted, and then do not receive treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if you reach the acute aposteme, then you should administer in the sedation of that water in which our narration precedes, in another place of treatment and of embrocation, until it is removed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter 34.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of dislocation of the toes of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It is necessary that what is dislocated be reduced with little extension of its strength; and that which is not difficult, therefore it is easier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	Perhaps the dislocation is in some toes of the foot, then it is necessary to make the patient sit with their foot on the ground or on a table, and stand thus as if they were going.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand on feet, and stop the foot on that which is imagined from the joints, and then calcify that in the foot in a virtuous manner until it returns, and you see that already reduced and does not appear in the eminent place.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then stop below the belly of the foot on a table that holds the entire foot, to which are two cups, and then strengthen it in a decent structure and firm for three days; and then remove that and make it rest from walking for many days, until it is strengthened and the recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	On the species of dislocation that are made by plague or fracture or any other evil encounters.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When you reach some cause of those, and you persevere in the treatment of that and in the restoration of it, many expected successes follow, avoiding death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for that reason it is not necessary to presume on the treatment of the patient, but rather one who is wise in the art, with long experience, merciful and pitied, tardy, not arrogant nor presumptuous; and who uses in the beginning of medicines that calm apostemes as much as possible, and leaves the patient to divine judgment, but rather to whom they hope for salvation from perdition, with alleviation of the malady, and in which appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And therefore it is necessary to strive so much for the reduction in the beginning of the cause, since then the acute aposteme will be avoided.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And therefore if the member returns according to what we want, then administer a regimen that calms the acute aposteme and cures the plague with what is convenient for the joints of the dried-out limbs.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is with a fracture and reaches the separated sacred bones, then you perform the statement of theirs, and do in that what we have said in the simple maladies of that which is preceded in those places.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And beware and escape according to your virtue that of the instrument in the ways of fear as it has been preceded by my preaching; for that is better for you to serve your Creator, and more permanent to your glory, and more greetings to your cosmos truly existing in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the paragraphs of Albucasim perfectly, of which God may be blessed.
Amen.	Amen.
